Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and friendly service!”
Reviews.Author: Claire B Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A little gem of a hotel in a great location. No bar or restaurant but plenty close by so this wasn't a problem. Hotel staff were very helpful including providing an extra blanket promptly and printing out tickets booked online. The bed was extremely comfortable and the room was clean and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel for the money and service”
Reviews.Author: frack77
Reviews.Content: OK, I am going to start out by saying Johanes at the front desk deserves the service award of the year for foreign travelers. Anything you ask him he does his best to help you and with a great, genuine smile. Directions, suggestions, their aim is to please. We stayed for 7 nights and experienced 3 rooms on the 4th floor. Get a wow room. I have been told that this floor has the largest rooms so I would request that floor if possible. The noise on the street was not bothersome and we sleep with the door/window open. We can't say enough about location, the tapas bar across the street or the cleanliness of the place. We loved 406, the very largest, 402 was perfect and 411 was the smaller regular room. If you have any questions fire away as this is a great place and even if your Spanish is lacking their English is great!

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona in March”
Reviews.Author: travellinglady1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Praktik Rambla for 10 days in March. Our room was an upgraded double decorated in Black and White with a huge king-size bed. The room was clean and comfortable and had a mosaic tile floor. The desk staff were friendly, enthusiastic, helpful. We also enjoyed the jazz music in the lobby. The hotel in conveniently located to many of the sites in Barcelona and also near 2 metro stops. We ate breakfast in a restaurant near the hotel using a voucher.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was just perfect for staying in the heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: strikerslefty
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I traveled with friends and it was our first time in Spain. We arranged all of our own travel plans and found the Hotel Praktik Rambla on the internet. We chose it based on character, price, location and Trip Advisor reviews. We stayed 5 nights and found it to be very charming. The front desk has excellent customer service at the front desk. Hotel Praktik Rambla is a beautiful building (the history of the Architect is interesting as well) with a terrace for relaxing, library and free wifi and internet station. We were pleasantly surprised to be upgraded to superior rooms which had a balcony.The rooms are simple and bathrooms nice. I have never stayed at such an architecturally beautiful hotel. Photos taken from the balcony were really beautiful as well. Really, the location is so convenient to Las Rambla, shopping, transportation and no shortage of restaurants. The front desk also assisted in dining suggestions and printing boarding passes(thank you Olivia) for the journey home. Overall, this hotel was just right for us!

Reviews.Title: “Very central, good service, however smelly bathroom”
Reviews.Author: easygoing15
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights. This hotel is in a very good , central location. Room with high ceiling, reasonably nice however, bathroom has a strong drainage smell which makes our stay a bit unfortable. It helps when we closed the door but unpleasant when go in there. Initially we thought it's the area but by chance we tried the toilet near the computer on the 1st floor and it was ok. Some tips: Don't stay in room 207 as it smell. Room 208 and 209 on the 1st floor can be noisy. It is recommended to take the hop on hop off bus as this bus goes to the mountain part of Barcelona. When take the hop on hop off bus we recommend that you hop off stop no. 8 (orange line). Here you can take the steps to walk down to stop no. 11 (bull ring). There is a water show every evening around 8 pm. The tapas place next door (Picapolos??) is quite cheap and nice, worth a try!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel near Placa de Catalunya”
Reviews.Author: FerrisXL
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights at this hotel and found it the perfect choice. Located near Placa de Catalunya, it's just a short stroll from the airport bus stop and the next metro station. Many sights such as Las Ramblas, the old town, Casa Battlo etc. are easily reachable by foot. Being located in an area with lot's of nice cafes, bars and restaurant, it's no problem at all that the hotel doesn't have its own restaurant or many facilities. We had a standard double room which was not very big but had everything you need. The bathroom was comparably big and very nicely decorated, with a good shower. The reception staff couldn't have been more friendly and helpful. The building itself is very beautiful and charming. This hotel offers great value for money and good service in a perfect loction. We will definitely consider staying here again when in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Well done LUXE - Another good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChilliLondon
Reviews.Content: Another great recommendation from the LUXE guide. We booked this hotel as this guide has never let us down in any city we have visited in the world. Hotel is very lovely building, high ceilings, lovely old style look. The rooms are clean, modern, comfy bed, spacious bathroom, great shower. TV at the foot of the bed, that's all i need whilst away, and it was great. Daily room service. Nice and central almost opposite ciudad for Tapas, nice bar and restaurant next door, everywhere within walking distance. I would stay here again! Perfecto..

Reviews.Title: “Really nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: naillig07
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff and really nice room. We didn't order breakfast but ate out most days there's plenty of places around that offer great tapas. Be careful of Obama bar around the corner from Praktik Rambla they tried to put lots of extra drinks on to our bill. Pay as you go. La flauta tapas bar a couple of streets away is really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Praktik Rambla - What a Gem!”
Reviews.Author: John T Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for somewhere different, somewhere with delightful rooms and friendly professional service, look no further than Praktik Rambla. We came to it by chance but what a find - great location with bars and restaurants all around, walking distance of many sights and great for connection to public transport. Breakfast at the next door Piscolabis could have been better but, hey, that was a tiny flaw in an otherwise perfect stay. If you can get room 2009, go for it...it has a sweet balcony and an enormous bed!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Reviewer02
Reviews.Content: Loved my stay here. The hotel is in a perfect location - within walking distance of many sights and close to several Metro stops too. It's on a lovely street, one block away from the main shopping area, tree-lined and full of restaurants/cafes. The building itself is beautifully restored, with many original features - we had a superior room, with high ceilings, cornices, a balcony on to the main street and a large, comfy bed. There's no restaurant/bar etc, but with this location that is not an issue at all. It's also a very short easy walk to the Airport bus stop. We experienced no noise from surrounding rooms, and the room itself was kept spotless and well supplied. The noise from the street was quite loud at the weekend, but did not prevent sleep and you would expect this from such a central location. The hotel staff were also exceptionally professional and responded quickly to all emails before our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Happy but not blown away”
Reviews.Author: Dewiohare
Reviews.Content: Summary- my wife & I stayed in room 405 for three nights arriving on the 6th April 2012 and were reasonably happy with our stay. Excellent: - reception staff, very helpful and pleasant! - clean room - we checked early (11am) as our room was available and check out is 12pm with free bag storage after that. Good: - location to tourist attractions, transport options, and restaurants. - big comfy bed - hotel & room had good style - shower  - rate for three nights compared to other hotels with similar class/location - free wifi with a strong connection although the data seemed to trickle and emails/websites loaded slowly Poor: - room was very small - no bath, bare essentials in bathroom - bathroom air conditioning fan smelt of drains - bathroom toiletries were limited and not resupplied when empty - hotel iron is (available from reception) damaged with no ironing board - no full length mirror Terrible: - room door doesn't stop corridor noise. Good luck getting an uninterrupted night of sleep with other guests coming & going, or sleeping in after 8:30am with maids knocking about! Would we stay again? - only with a very good rate

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Location - Shame about the TINY bedroom”
Reviews.Author: Dennis B
Reviews.Content: The Hotel looks awesome on the web. It looks great when you walk through the front door. Unfortunately, the tiny bedroom spoils everything. I had to climb over my wife to get into the double bed which was squeezed against a wall in what I would describe as a single room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and very stylish”
Reviews.Author: Gerard K
Reviews.Content: This is a superb location just up from the Placa Catalunya. The staff are very friendly and it is very stylish. There is a PC for internet access on the first floor with a nice coffe drinking area and roof Patio. We didn't have breakfast but if you do it is in the restaurant next door. The bathroom was excellent. It is not a place to take children, not because it is child unfriendly but because children under 15-16 would probably not like it.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: jozzy3000
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel - very modern and chic. Great outdoor patio and very spacious rooms. We had a very good experience here and I would highly recommend. The location is also perfect: right across the street from very good tapas restaurants (Cuidad Contal) and only two blocks away from the top of the Las Ramblas (so the streets aren't too touristy/busy) and the Plaza Catalunya metro stop.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy, and no hot water in the mornings”
Reviews.Author: Simon S
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice looking and the rooms were clean, but... Its very noisy on a night (take ear plugs). The water is solar heated, so cold showers in the morning - this may be better in high summer, but we had 4 days of cold showers - apparently this is a problem they have been meaning to resolve for some time....manyana? No TV reception, didn't bother us much, but if your paying €170 a night you expect it to work. Wifi is free, but you can only register one device per room. Its fairly difficult to find as it only has its name printed on one side of a rather tatty looking yellow canvas awning. On the whole very poor value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Short break”
Reviews.Author: Harrison056
Reviews.Content: On arival we were made to feel very welcome by the receptionist.We were given a upgrade to our room free of charge,to a superior room,that was great.I can't comment on a standard room we never got to see one.The breakfast was next door in a seperate restaurant .The breakfast was disapointing.The hotel is in a ideal location 5 minute walk from the main square. Taxi from airport is expensive,Take the bus easy and cheap.Easy Jet departures from terminal 2 are not from the main terminal they are a short walk to the left of the terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Service, Cleanliness, and Price!”
Reviews.Author: Amy K Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We were thrilled with our stay at Hotel Praktik and would highly recommend it. The location was great, nearby the metro and right up the street from the plaza and La Rambla. The staff was very friendly, room was clean and comfortable, and we were granted our request for a street view room, which was a perfect location to watch all of the goings on on the street below, adding to the overall experience of Spain. The price was perfect and I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Praktik Rambla- Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: 685Michael
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about the wonderful front desk service at this hotel-- just about the most helpful staff I have ever experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Nazish H
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Barcelona and we were advised to stay on Las Ramblas. We accidently booked this hotel which was at the end of Ramblas and I couldn't be happier with my location. It is minutes away from Ramblas but has better restaurants around. The area was very lively even in the late hours of the night. And the Tapas bar across the street is a MUST GO! The hotel itself was very nice. It was clean and very trendy. There is not alot of extra space in the room but it is just enough! And the staff was super friendly! Everyone spoke English and gave us a lot of helpful tips. Will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place!!!!! fantastic value”
Reviews.Author: lmyren
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Praktik for one night - the building and its interior are really beautiful. We got upgraded to a superior room - the room had really high ceiling which made the room seem so much larger then it really was. The bed was really comfy!!!! The bath was superb with a rain forest shower overlooking the terrace.. (perfect if you are an exhibitionist:):)).... The service was really good both in the reception and for breakfast. Hotel Praktik has a fantastic location at Rambla de Catalunya just a short walk from where you want to be:) The hotel offers free wifi - which should be standard at all hotels. We will for sure stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Got2
Reviews.Content: Overall we enjoyed this hotel but it is rather noisy. Staff very good. Rooms rather compact

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly A
Reviews.Content: We first went to the wrong hotel (The Praktik), but were directed to Praktik Rambla a few blocks away. The receptionist at The Praktik was really nice and said it happens all the time. When we arrived at the correct hotel we were NOT dissapointed. Not only was the hotel itself beautiful, the staff was extremely helpful and nice. They upgraded our room for free. The room itself was big and the balcony was adorable. The bed was SO comfortable and huge! The shower had a rainfall shower head which was awesome. You can't beat the location in my opinion. You can walk to the water and to Sagrada Familia if you want. I loved this city and can't wait to go back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “My place in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: Aleksandra M
Reviews.Content: Fantastic place. Great location, beautiful design and good price! Rooms are clean and beds huge and very comfortable. Bathroom is so pretty but it can be a bit cold during the winter time.They have lovely terracce where you can enjoy sun during the day or a bottle of cava in the evening. I've booked a double room with additional bed for our small daughert and we've got a really big room 409 with a TV niche with sofa. The additionall bed was so big that it will be ok even for two persons. Staff is really helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: robo7881
Reviews.Content: We stayed this month for 3 nights the hotel was clean, the staff were helpful recommending places to eat etc. We were on a mini honeymoon and they very knidly upgraded us FOC, very centre just a few mintues walk from La rambla. Would really recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small and modern”
Reviews.Author: Luv_a_beach27
Reviews.Content: The rooms were cute with a modern style. We upgraded to a Superior room, but I don’t feel we benefitted from the upgrade price. My father had a regular double room and the only difference between the two was space and a balcony with a view. If you are concerned about having a spacious bedroom and balcony then an upgrade would be fine. Nothing seemed more spacious about the bathrooms in the upgrade, but they were good. The only thing I would change is how open the shower is without a curtain because it splashed water outside onto the floor. Some other details include: - Bottles of water are available at the front desk on request and for a fee. - Plenty of closet space in the Superior Double room - Nice sized hair dryer available in bath - Nice rain shower - Flat Screen TV (we never used it) - Very fluffy pillows, beds are firm - Safe available The staff was wonderful and very accommodating. We drove into town and it was VERY easy to park. Parking prices were very comparable to any major downtown city. This hotel is very small which makes it quiet and quaint. The location was PERFECT! It was just a block from the popular Las Ramblas and very easy for convenience. The restaurant next door had great tappas and wine. I would definitely stay at the Praktik again! Some suggestions to the hotel for improvements would include: Softer towels Better protection from the shower splash Coffee maker in room (a personal preference)

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: cameramel
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Praktik Rambla is an ideal hotel to use in this fantastic city. We had the most hassle free break ever. The trip from the airport on the Aerobus was simplicity itself (5.30 Euros) the end of the route is in Catalunya square which is a very gentle 5 minute stroll from the hotel. Check in was very quick and friendly especially as we had paid in advance. Check out was equally easy as there is none of the usual mini bar rubbish (There is no minibar). The room was small but very ergonomic and comfortable with a fantastic shower and bed. the decor is very Gaudi but very tastefully adapted to 21st century accommodation. The hotel could not be more central, with Los Ramblas a 10 minute stroll away.Incredible choice of restaurants as you step out of the door. Only slight downside is the lack of tea and coffee making facilities. Very good value and we would make it first choice when we return to this fabulous city.

Reviews.Title: “Just stuning!”
Reviews.Author: Emily M
Reviews.Content: Since we arrived, we knew this was going to be a wonderful experience.. The entrance of the hotel is beautiful! The reception, a little small but charming. We booked a standard room, but once there we were told that they had made a free upgrade to our reservation and a superior room was given! Absolutely no words for the room! It was HUGE, in the 4th floor with a balcony to the Ramblas, very modern bathroom with a potent shower and free wi-fi, but no mini bar. It’s close to almost everything, few minutes walking to Plaza Catalunya and the ramblas. We specially loved the terrace! Very chic decoration which combined perfectly for a cup of wine in the afternoons.. It was our first time in Barcelona, and we want to thank the staff for all their help, especially Arthur, which every night asked about the things we were up to and recommended us the places to visit, restaurants and walks around the city! Thank you for your special care! We would definitely come back to Barcelona and recommend this hotel to our friends!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, super nice, well equipped, but a bit small”
Reviews.Author: pmulia
Reviews.Content: the room is clean, it has wifi, you can practically walk everywhere. The building was old but beautiful, nice terrace! it also has an elevator for those who can't climb the stairs.. The only downside I could think of was the size of the room which is small. BUT, I don't mind it at all, you practically spend most of your time outside anyway

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Bent C Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Praktik Rambla is a small but very nice hotel. Small rooms, but very modern decoration and nice design, in old rooms. Very nice location in the best district in Barcelona. Very good service. Only negative was the smell of old house in the second room we had.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Clairefair
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Praktik Rambla for a romantic weekend and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. We loved the hotel's friendly staff, traditional ambiance, high ceilings and decor. We had a beautiful room with a king-sized bed and nice linens, and a nice bathroom with pretty green tiles and a walk-in shower big enough for two. The hotel is in a great part of the city with lots of shops, restaurants and cafes. Every morning we had a delicious breakfast on the terrace of the Forn de Sant Jaume bakery just down the street. We would definitely stay at this hotel again. Our only small suggestion would be to have a kettle available in the room for those early morning or post bar cuppas...

Reviews.Title: “Very good, very central”
Reviews.Author: TeresaBee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Praktik Rambla for four nights in February 2012, with my mother; we each had a standard double room, which meant they were inward-facing, but even so they still had natural light and were very spacious. The hotel is 19th-century and very elegant, with lovely mosaic floors and floral carvings on the walls, but the rooms are very modern and the beds big and comfortable. I have to say that I wasn't very keen on the shower, but this was a minor issue. The staff are friendly and helpful and fluent in several languages. There is no breakfast room or restaurant in the hotel, but there is a nice lounge/conservatory where we went to sit and drink a bottle of wine in the evening, and there are plenty of places nearby where you can go for meals - we had breakfast a couple of times at Matamala, a block or so nearer the Placa Catalunya, where you can get a very nice coffee and croissant for €3. The hotel is extremely central, very close to the Catalunya metro station and a few minutes' walk from the Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: EmilyOhh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed her for the first half of our honeymoon and could not have been happier. First off, the staff was incredible. He let us check in early after a red eye flight from NYC, gave us a map and showed us all the places we asked about. He literally knew everything. He even gave us a few hours to pay for our room when our debit card wasn't working overseas (had to find an ATM). The room went above our expectations! From what I understand, it is close to impossible to find an "american" sized room in Europe. Well, they have them here! I can't decide if the bathroom or the view from the balcony was better. I am usually not a fan of the Ultra-Modern look that Europe is so fond of right now, but Hotel Prakrik did a fantastic job of combining the old with the new. We really loved this hotel, and for the price, it was well worth it. Hotels down the street are twice this much, and the location is the same. Stay here, you wont regret it. My husband and I still talk about how much we loved this hotel a year later. We really can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: Poojoobee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here last May but I just realized I forgot to write a review. We read a lot of reviews online that we shouldn't stay on Las Ramblas so we stayed here upon the recommendation of a friend. This hotel is in a perfect location! It's in an area called Catalunya which is full of shopping and restaurants. It is a 5 minute walk to the double decker city bus and touristic center to book other trips. It is less than 10 minutes from Las Ramblas and if you really feel up to it, you can even walk to La Barceloneta (the beach) which is probably about a 30 minute walk. The front desk staff is very nice and super helpful. Very knowledgable about touristy type questions as well. The hotel itself is very tiny and quaint. Typical European style. The good thing is, while in Barcelona, you will barely spend any time in the hotel. The room itself is super small but the bathroom is a very nice size. The hotel is very modern and clean. There is a courtyard area on the roof with lounge chairs that is really nice. There is no kitchen or bar on premises but food and drinks can be found right next door and all around the area. We spent 4 days there and one day we did the double decker bus tour which I would highly recommend to see all of Gaudi's work. We also did a day trip to Montserrat- just took the train out there which was super easy. The views were just gorgeous. We went to a flamenco show, visited the impressive W Hotel, ate some great food, got lost in Boqueria, hung out at the beach, partied with the locals and walked the entire city. It was an amazing trip in one of the most amazing cities. And this hotel made all of it a little more enjoyable and a lot easier!

Reviews.Title: “this hotel made our stay much better”
Reviews.Author: zooc0904
Reviews.Content: My mother and I really liked how kind and friendly the staff were. When I had some problem with the room and I was really upset, a stuff at the reception dealt with it as soon as possible. We really appreciate them trying really hard to do whatever we asked. Moreover, the location was really convenient to take metro and the room was so nice and clean. We would love to stay this hotel again. However , it would have been even better if there had been a mini bar in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Slighty Modern with good location”
Reviews.Author: Sarah W
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two night stay here. Thought the location was great, a few blocks from las ramblas and in the shopping area. Rooms were a little sterile and didn’t particular enjoy the rain shower head. With that said the room was fairly quiet and the staff was extremely pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: KatLLondon
Reviews.Content: Very nice clean and trendy hotel. Very good location in the city, easy to get to all the shops! Bathroom was lovely, large walk in shower, very clean. The only down side was the lounge - It was a really nice room but doesn't appear to be used very well. There is no bar or cafe which seemed slightly strange as it would have been a lovely environment for one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: akarlstroem
Reviews.Content: Great location! Within walking distance of Plaça Catalunya, is close to several subway and bus lines, various shops of famous brands, excellent restaurants and major tourist attractions of Barcelona. In addition, the building of the early 19th century is an attraction on its own: a very beautiful facade and full of nice architectural details inside.

Reviews.Title: “Visiting Barcelona during low season”
Reviews.Author: wheresmycocktail
Reviews.Content: My stay here was better than average but i don't know if I would say very good. I would say good best describes it. So I visited Barcelona for three days in January and not sure where to stay. I found Praktik through Tripadvisor and it got good reviews so I thought I would check it out for myself. As soon as I booked my non refundable stay I saw a pop up advertising their sister hotel about five minutes away for about 30% less so that was a bummer. I still got a reduced price with Praktik Rambla (probably because it's winter season) and if you stay for three or more nights you get a free 10 ride metrocard. I booked a room with two twin beds for myself and guest but we were upgraded to a room with King bed. When we were told of the upgrade at the front desk I didn't understand that there was only one bed, I just thought the whole room was larger. Luckily I was with my mother so we didn't mind sharing the bed and when we got to the room we found it was just two twins put together to equal the king (did they not want to take the time to separate the beds?) so the room was probably about the same size as a double twin anyway. Some people might consider the room to be small but I thought it was very spacious for European standards. There was plenty of room to move around the bed and the bathroom was quite large. *Bonus* the bathroom has a good strong hairdryer! The decor of the room and bath was dark and sleek and the hotel had an overall Gothic look to it and it was pretty. There IS an elevator here and it does hold more than ONE person. Anyone who has been in a French elevator knows how small they can get. The front desk staff were friendly and guided us to various locations by map. There is free wifi although the signal can get a little weak on tablets I had no problem with my laptop. There is also free use of a computer near the lounge. There is no kitchen on site so if you order breakfast you actually take it at the restaurant right next door. My only annoyance during my stay was being woken up by my neighbor practicing guitar. We asked the front desk to take care of it and they did contact the room but the quiet only lasted a few minutes. We gave up and left the room. So just beware that the walls are thin. On a positive note,one of the best things about this hotel is the location. It is on Rambla de Catalunya which is full of restaurants and shops. You can spend the whole day just walking up and down this street. It is only two blocks from Placa Catalunya which is where the open top tour buses, 10 min walk to La Boqueria, and 2 min walk to Passeig de Gracia, so for tourists I recommend this hotel. I would consider coming back to this hotel if I can get the same rate again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Marcosuru
Reviews.Content: A minute walk from Plaza Catalunya in one of the best locations of Barcelona. Decoration is a bit on the dark side, but people is great and friendly. It is very easy to move around Barcelona from here, many subway stations nearby and many attractions are within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: BernieLuton
Reviews.Content: This is just, quite simply, a fantastic hotel. It's probably in one of the best spots in Barcelona but just off the very main area so avoids any noise issues. It's so easy to get to on the airport bus and then a couple of minutes walk from Place Catalunya. The staff are very friendly and helpful, particularly Arthur, he even telephoned us the day before we travelled to confirm our booking and welcome us in advance. If you re being put off by no breakfast or the negative comments about going next door for it - don t be because there's a wonderful coffee/delicatessen shop immediately opposite which was super and very cheap too where we ate in the mornings - we ended up buying loads of nibbly things to bring home too... Also special mention to La Tramoia, Tapas bar located on the corner near the hotel - again lovely staff and two glasses of nice house red 5 euros! If you ve never been to Barcelona - go! You ll love!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mrvin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in March 2011 for 3 nights. Great location in a smart area only a few mins walk from Placa Catalunya, but quite quiet around at night. One of the best things is that the airport train goes to Passeig de Gracia station and this hotel is less than 5 mins walk from there meaning you dont have to drag your bags around the metro system when you first arrive. Hotel is a lovely old building. Rooms small but clean. Great shower. Had breakfast in Piscolabis (below hotel) every day. Very good value. Freshly squeezed orange and a nice croissant every morning. Some good restaurants within walking distance. Only downside was we had no view whatsoever. But for about £90 a night i think we paid, you cant really fault it for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Praktikly perfect!”
Reviews.Author: LouiseJamieson2012
Reviews.Content: exellent yet simple, plenty of room (room 404), well maintained and clean. We had fantastic views of Rambla de Catalunya which looked lovely lit up at night. Though its slightly noisy,that is to be expected being right in the city centre. The shutters helped to some extent. If you are looking for a hotel that is right in the middle of it all at a reasonable price then this hotel is for you. The staff we encountered were very helpful and friendly and good english speakers. its a shame that there were no tea or coffee facilities in the room, but then every other building was a cafe so it didnt bother us too much. the bathroom was clean and the shower was nice and powerful (the rain shower very relaxing and the handheld very invigorating!) Staying at the hotel offers 10% discount in some lovely nearby restaurants, we went to the Tapa Tapa bar about 5/10 minute walk away and it was delicious and very reasonable. If we go back to Barcelona again (which we will!) then i would not hesitate to book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: clareuk_11
Reviews.Content: Perfect location; rooms are beautifully clean. Really good for singles (small but stylish, and very clean). The receptionists could not have been more helpful. Also fantastic was the lovely bar/cafe next door.

Reviews.Title: “A great spot in a wonderful town”
Reviews.Author: silvertip64
Reviews.Content: We hated to leave. Upgrade a little, get a bigger room in the back of the hotel. Big, clean and spacious, and comfortable. And then when you walk outside- you are in the middle of one of the greatest cities in the world. It's worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Full of character in great location”
Reviews.Author: kevzz5
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights between christmas and new year. It's a very understated hotel with unique touch to every details. The lobby is small but beautiful with high atrium space. We stayed in Room 308, a standard twin room with windows facing the courtyard behind, so it's really quiet at night. The room is comfortable with nice furnishing and the bathroom is brilliant. What we love about this hotel is the free wifi and the location, close to both Gaudi's casas and the shopping street of Garcia. Brief walk to La Ramblas, really great location. If there's any complaints, I think there is some design issue with the bathroom. The door to the bathroom is very clunky and noisy to use, especially at night. And also the use of fabric curtain in the bathroom which straddles between the toilet and shower cubicle is not really practical. The rain shower is not really working as it's more of a drizzle, has to use the handheld shower instead. Otherwise, we think this is a great hotel with great value definitely worth recommending!

Reviews.Title: “Super-friendly reception, great location”
Reviews.Author: jordievox
Reviews.Content: Arriving by train at Pg. Gracia station, it was just around 7 minutes walk to the hotel on the "posh" bit of the Ramblas Catalunya. We have seldom experienced such friendly and helpful reception staff. Nothing was too much trouble. Initially I had a slight problem with our standard room, because, although state-of-the-art modern, with a huge comfortable bed, the only "window" looked onto a kind of shaft, where one could only see daylight by craning one's neck upwards. I had a slight panic-claustrophobia attack and tried to get a different room, but they were all booked out. In the end it wasn't a problem as we were out all day anyway. There was free internet use on our floor, plus a decked terrace with chairs and tables. The location was excellent, with shops, restaurants, the Old Town, etc. within easy walking distance. If I could get a room with a view next time, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: JeanCheltenham
Reviews.Content: We loved the architecture of this fabulously quirky hotel and we (all of 8 of us) would definitely use the hotel again. We were in Barcelona for a surprise 60th family gathering and the staff went along with our 'secret' and made the whole four days a trip to remember. Most of our party had rooms upgraded (it was a pity our daughter, who had a small single room, was the only one who could have benefitted more from an upgrade but wasn't offered an upgrade). We had a 7 month only baby in our party and the hotel made sure the parents had everything they needed for our grandson and was able to provide a kettle to use when needed. The slight down-side was that the restaurant next door were in total contrast to hotel staff. The restaurant staff (we know this was a separate business to hotel) were not very friendly at all. When we come back to Barcelona, we will stay in the hotel but will not eat at the restaurant next door. Perhaps Mr Prieto can source another restaurant nearby who would welcome his breakfast vouchers and who are more amiable to hotel guests?

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: ELBSBarcelona
Reviews.Content: We're a family of four (2 kids 14 and 9), checked in yesterday. We booked 2 doubles and one of our rooms was upgraded to the Superior. The double is a little small but very functional while the Superior is just perfect. The hotel is truly gorgeous. Full of character and the architecture is just so beautiful, and my kids were expecting the room to be antique and old, so imagine their surprise when we opened the door to a modern well-thought out room. Amenities were not extensive, a soap, shampoo and bath gel but the quality was really good. The towels were really nice-smelling, better than in many hotels we've been to. There was free wifi too, for as many devices as we had, which is great during downtime in the room. Everything works well, the shower is hot with good water pressure, good hair-dryer (not the tiny ones some hotels provide), there's no iron or ironing board in the room but you can ask for an iron if you need one (we don't miss it and will probably need it only on the last day of our stay). Whatever you truly need is in the room, which is why I say everything's been really well thought-out. And the location is just so convenient. Many of the wonderful restaurants I found recommended on the internet is within walking distance from the hotel. The main shopping street La Ramblas is just 2 blocks down, as is Placa Catalunya, where the Aerobus stops. There's a small minimart just across the street to stock up drinking water (only 80 cents for 1.5 litres!). To get to Parc Guell, we only needed to walk a block away to Passeig De Gracia to catch bus 24. I reckon we save a lot of walking and taxi fares and time staying in this great location. Lastly, service is wonderful. All my emails enquiring about rates, rooms etc were promptly replied, usually within hours. The staff also made the effort to arrange for our 2 rooms to be next to each other (there are no connecting rooms here), which we really appreciated. Overall, truly value for money. We're looking forward to the rest of our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, great value, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Richard_in_Oakland
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in a great location. The Eixample neighborhood is very well situated for Ramblas, Gotic, Gaudi buildings, great shopping, restaurants. Front desk staff were helpful, and the room staff kept the place very clean. We stayed in a big, stylish triple room for a great price just before Xmas. Three minor recommendations: 1. Improve the quality of the mattress on the 3rd bed. It was a thinnish mattress on a hard surface. Our daughter would have slept better with more comfort. 2. Put some hooks on the walls for coats, towels, purses, etc. Room started looking like a heap because there was no place to hang everything. 3. Shave 1 cm off the bottom of the bathroom door. The rain shower (very nice, BTW) created lots of spray that soaked the floor but the floor mat kept on being scrunched up by the door when we came in or out. Make some space under the door, so that the mat stays flat and absorbs the water.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: pinkhoneypie
Reviews.Content: Hi, we stayed at the Practic for 4 nights the week before Christmas. The hotel is extremely stylish and has an ideal situation at the top of the Rambles, so very central for everything. We had a superior double room and it was stunning. The room was large, very chic and stylish with a mirrored wall and black and white minimalist decor. The bed was huge and very comfortable with lovely bed linen and pillows to die for. There was heating/air con which was very efficient. The bathroom was very luxurious with a big walk in shower (but no bath). My favourite part of the room was the french doors opening onto the balcony overlooking the street, stunning. The staff were very friendly and helpful throughout our stay. The only thing lacking is tea.coffee making facilities in your room. We were aware of this and so took our own travel kettle. The hotel has a beautiful rooftop terraced area with sunloungers and sofas etc but it just didn't feel the same without a cold glass of wine or a gin and tonic in your hand. However, we had a lovely stay and would recommend the hotel, just remember to take your kettle.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: city-girl100
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a couple of nights and found this a great base to explore Barcelona. You're only a short walk to the Ramblas and Placa Catalunya. There is a great Tapas bar on the corner. The rooms are all very individual but we had a lovely large room with balcony over the main street which wasn't too noisy at night. The staff are very friendly. There is a nice little terrace. A great no frills hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: hopebh
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The location was good for the places that we wanted to see and we felt it was a very good value. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We stayed in one of the bigger rooms in the front of the hotel and would not hesitate to stay here again. The hotel did not have room service, but there were so many restuarants right outside the door that we didn't mind. The hotel offers a breakfast voucher for the restaurant next door for 7 euros. After the first day we skipped it because we didn't think it was a good value and because the service was so slow.

Reviews.Title: “great location and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: ruthy93
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my daughter for 3 nights and liked the area and the closeness to the Rmamblas and the Bari Gotic. the staff was very helpful and plite and answered all our questions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: VeraPec
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights.Beautiful designed hotel in the heart of Barcelona. We were upgraded to superior room with large balcony. I can really recommend the stay to other visitors. Very nice hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Odour but good location”
Reviews.Author: L-n-L_Hat
Reviews.Content: Typically I write positive reviews but unfortunately I am not able to do so after staying at Hotel Praktik Rambla. We experienced a problem due to a bad odour in our rooms (on the second and third floor). Unfortunately management denied there was a problem. Both my husband and I found the smell to be very problematic. The smell was strongest in the bathroom. It was a mouldy, sewer type smell. To help with the bad odour we tried to keep a room card in place when away from the hotel so that the bathroom fan could remain on. Unfortunately housekeeping staff would remove it. We were concerned about our health. At night the bathroom door was closed and the fan left on. Initially we stayed on the first floor and we did not notice a smell but when returned for a subsequent visit we were on third floor and the smell was unacceptable. Our room was changed to a second floor room which still had odour problems.The higher up in the hotel the stronger the smell. There were other issues such as wifi did not always work, no chairs in room or on small balcony, poor lighting in closet and limited hangers. Housekeeping did not replenish toiletries regularly. Most staff were not friendly or helpful. No hotel information was given upon checking in by staff or via writing in the room. The rooms we choose were superior rooms called Praktik WOW rooms. They did not “WoW” us. Positive points for this hotel are it's location and some of the beautiful architecture. We would not stay here again as our health is important and the price is expensive for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Superb !”
Reviews.Author: Paul V
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in some of the best hotels all around Europe, the room and the locations has always been great. What makes this hotel stand out and will always be our first choice is the service. JOHANES who was on reception was extremely helpful, He even drew us a map of the city, and recommended us the best restaurants to visit. So good that in fact, we actually went to all his recommendation at least 3 times in our week there, now, how can anything beat that. JOHANES for first time visitor in Barcelona, it was so memorable. Thank you very much for the memories, we will keep it with us and will definitely recommend the well managed and staffed establishment to anyone. 100% recommended, book with confidence. Thank you for the memories.... Anita & Paul Venture

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yesmore
Reviews.Content: Great design hotel in the city centre of Barcelona. Wonderfull decorated, beautiful shower and large beds. Hotel does offer breakfast in a nice place next door. Very nice hotel manager.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grand_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights while in Barcelona for the weekend. This hotel is really well located if you are keen to explore the city centre which is within a few minutes walk. The staff were friendly and welcoming. We visited during a quiet period and were upgraded to a double superior room which had an exterior balcony. The room was great - stylish and well equipped with a fantastic shower, lovely bathroom, and super comfy bed. This is a great little hotel for the traveller who likes to get out and about and experience the city and is not dependent on many faclities within the Hotel. There are two restaurants either side of the hotel but neither are operated by the hotel. There is also a great Outdoor terrace on the first floor but it wasn't weather for sitting out while we were there! Overall, we loved this hotel and would recommend it to others and plan to stay again on our next visit to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic room, great location”
Reviews.Author: hollyblake84
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a 3 night stay in Barcelona and would thoroughly recommend this hotel. Our room was beautiful with lovely original features and stylish, comfy furniture - the rest of the building was also very pretty. We were particularly pleased with the room given the amount that we paid for our stay though I suspect that we benefitted from travelling off season. The location is perfect, very central and just a few minutes walk from the metro and Las Ramblas - it's also easy to get the bus to and from the airport, the bus stop is just 5 mins walk away. We found the staff to be very helpful and we liked the fact that the checkout was at 12 - Barcelona is a great city for late nights and lie ins! Breakfast wasn't included in our room rate but we found plenty of places nearby that suited us, we actually preferred being able to get out and have breakfast in a variety of places rather than being tied to the hotel. The only slight complaint was that it was a bit noisy. We could hear the people in the room above us when they were walking around (though noise from outside was minimal).

Reviews.Title: “A nice experience”
Reviews.Author: demichelis_veronica
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel during our honeymoon trip, and were overall very happy with the stay. Perfect location in a quiet but central area close to the subway. Friendly and service-minded staff at the hotel. The hotel interior and rooms are stylish and clean. The only dissapointment was brought by unfriendly staff at the breakfast restaurant next door (we have paid for breakfast included, and that was a mistake) - never smiling, impolite and almost rude. The breakfast was not worth the money, and honestly you can find better places nearby to eat in the morning. Besides that - great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Chic boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shortyshortcake
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel; full of character and great location

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: Ebola
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a wonderful location, close to the efficient underground transportation, and excellent cafes and sights. There is a small elevator in the hotel and a ramp. The building is historic and lovely, with modern updating. The shower and bathroom were recently refurbished--designer trendy, with dark green tiles, excellent modern fixtures and great shower. The service at the hotel was excellent. Wifi was a little spotty, which was the only negative during my stay. This may have been a temporary problem, but if wifi is critical for you, you may want to ask if it is dependable. Cafes are flanking the hotel, so there is no need to go far for breakfast or coffee. I didn't check it out, but there is a lounge in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Praktik- everything is "no problem"”
Reviews.Author: D-Phud
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel twice, and have found it to be a good compromise in Barcelona between a cheap place and expensive place. The hotel has the things that matter to us most: 1) good location right on Rambla de Catalunya, but in the quieter part in Eixample. (for those familiar with the area, you are right in the block near the statue of El toro assegut or thinking bull) It is also a short walk from metro station with transport from airport. 2) VERY comfortable large bed (US king sized) with nice bedding 3) big comfortable shower with hot water and good water pressure (both rain shower and hand held) 4) pleasant, courteous staff- all of our requests were met with a cheerful "no problem!" As a bonus, the building is also lovely and has some character- they seemed to have done their best to carve a modern hotel with amenities while preserving the character of the building. I think that they could utilize their common area/terrace more than they do- they offered free juices there in the afternoon, but that wasn't too exciting and very few guests seem to utilize it. The terrace area is lovely, however. The wireless internet access was free, but was a bit wonky (signal came in and out)- overall was decent, but not something you could rely on if you really needed internet. They do have a small computer for guests to use if needed. There is also a small (free) in room safe which is very handy. We paid 151 Euro/night in July so not a bad price all things considered. We would likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Chic and understated”
Reviews.Author: naomigryn
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Praktik Rambla for a second time because we love it so much the first time. The rooms are comfortable and quiet, despite being just a few minutes from the Ramblas. The bathrooms are particularly lovely, with green tiled walls and the building itself is very special. Very reasonably priced, but don't expect a mini-bar or room service. Wifi in the rooms if you've brought your own laptop, a hotel computer if you haven't and a terrace for sitting outside when it's sunny. The staff are helpful and friendly. Will be glad to stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here! Best European hotel yet!”
Reviews.Author: sefutlaw
Reviews.Content: I've travelled all over Europe, and this is HANDS DOWN MY FAVORITE HOTEL EVER! Hotel Prakitk Rambla met and exceeded ALL of my expectations for the perfect stay in Barcelona! They answered countless emails before our trip to help us plan every detail of our visit. They were friendly and helpful during our stay. The hotel is located in the best area of town--just north of Plaza de Catalunya and the Ramblas on the quieter and more chic Rambla de Catalunya. Everything is in walking distance. The hotel's restaurant, Piscolabis, is a very trendy and delicious tapas restaurant next door. All the restaurants on the street also have outside seating in the median of Rambla de Catalunya, which makes for a wonderful meal! The hotel itself is also gorgeous! High ceilings, old-world touches around every corner, yet updated on all the essentials! Free wifi throughout hotel. In-room safes. Staff speaks excellent English. We had the Doble Standard room for our first stay, and then a Doble Superior. The Doble Standard was nice, but the Doble Superior was well worth the extra money--more room and beautiful french doors overlooking the hotel terrace! No matter what room you get, this is the perfect hotel! You will not find a better value for your money anywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Great location..great room"”
Reviews.Author: RedMonkey25
Reviews.Content: Two block walk from airport bus stop.....very convenient to La Rambla-only a block away...staff was very helpful...Olivia had excellent English and explained the different tourist spots nearbye.Room was very spacious and bed very comfortable. Room 310 is very large and in back of hotel so quiet and a nice view from balcony door. I think this is an excellent value for a really nice hotel in a large European city at $550 for three nights. We did not get the breakfast option since there are many choices right outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice!”
Reviews.Author: Franibelle
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on tripadvisor. We are here now and are so pleased. We are in room 310, a large room at the back of the hotel with a king sized bed and a huge bath with a rain shower. It is quiet and comfortable. The front desk staff is friendly and helpful and the location is great! Thanks,tripadvisor for guiding us to this selection. You will not be sorry if you choose this hotel. In a charming old building,but updated completely and tastefully done. We think it is a bargain for such a nice hotel in a major European city.

Reviews.Title: “Super friendly, super helpful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mary_feed
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of a hotel. The staff were the nicest staff I have encountered and they spoke perdect English so communication was never a problem. The hotel is in a really cool building and the location was superb (next to Plaza Catalonia). Next time I visit Barcelona I will check in with them again. Thanks for making things so smooth.

Reviews.Title: “Charming boutique hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: biffytreepod
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights prior to a cruise at the Hotel Praktik Rambla. I picked this hotel based on TA reviews and we were glad we did. It is a beautiful old mansion converted to a small hotel. We had a room with a balcony on the fourth floor that looked out on the street below. Ours was a small balcony, no chairs, but I loved standing out there and taking in the views on the street. The room was clean and modern. One complaint is the lack of a chair in the room. The room isn't huge but if they could squeeze in a small chair or stool it would be nice. Also it would be nice to have a coffee maker. The front desk staff was helpful and polite. We sat on the terrace one day after returning to the hotel and found it to be very relaxing. We did not have breakfast included with our room but we had breakfast three times at the cafe right next to the hotel, Piscolabis. They had a breakfast special for 2.5 Euros for a breakfast sandwich and coffee. Cheap and good. We were able to walk to many of the tourist attractions and felt very safe at this hotel. We loved our stay and would definitely return to this hotel when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location, Spartan, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: TxToast
Reviews.Content: As many others have stated, the location of this hotel is prime. Easy access by foot, metro or taxi (taxi stand on the corner, just steps away) to all parts of the city. Easy walk to Placa Catalunya, La Boqueria, Barri Gotico, Casa Batllo and Casa Mila. Easy metro to Sagrada Familia, Placa Espanya and Montjuic. And it sits on one of the prettiest tree-lined boulevards in Eixample The hotel is clean and the staff is very friendly and helpful, all of whom spoke english well enough. However, I would suggest that, if amenities and being pampered are important to you, you should probably look elsewhere (and be prepared to pay much more). We got the "Praktik WOW" upgrade, which got us a superior room with a nice balcony view of the Rambla Catalunya, which was lovely. The room was about the size of a standard, budget hotel room in the U.S. The bed was large (U.S. "king size") and comfortable enough (if a tad bit firm) and there was just adequate space for hanging and storing clothes, suitcases, etc. Overall, we were quite pleased with our stay at Praktik Rambla and would recommend it to visitors that don't require the amenities. For example, if you get up early and want that first cup of coffeee right away, your best bet is to make the short (one-and-one-half block) hike to Starbucks for your morning Joe. The cafe next door (where you go for the inclusive breakfast, which we did not opt for) didn't open until after 9am while we were there. We knew before going that there would be little to no amenities and that was fine by us. We chose the hotel for its location and its value. We knew we would not be spending much time in the hotel so didn't see the point in paying for all the extras.

Reviews.Title: “Great artsy hotel in a prime location”
Reviews.Author: kevd193213
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a fantastic location, minutes from the subway, Catalunya Square and the beginning of Las Ramblas. The staff were great, we had an "issue" with our AC unit (we had not idea how the remote worked) and the front desk came up right away and walked us through the features. Rooms were large (we had double standard) and unbelievably clean, each evening it was as if we had a brand new room. The bathroom shower was huge as was the closet space, which includes a free safe. The thing that stood out was the style of the hotel and the rooms, which were very artsy yet comfortable at the same time. I would definitely stay here again. The only reason I did not give this a 5 is that there is not a restaurant or bar within the hotel itself, though they did offer juice from 3-5 each afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: Nosmo_King1949
Reviews.Content: The Praktik Rambla is in a great location near Catalunya Square, just a few blocks from the beginning of Las Ramblas. Our room was modern, clean and functional. Our only compalints were the room was very small and there was no view. Bed was large and comfortable. The shower was great (I have a "thing" about showers.) Hotel staff was courteous and attentive. They also spoke excellent English. We stayed in room 108.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Praktik Rambla”
Reviews.Author: Bill G
Reviews.Content: Great room - clean and light-filled. Staff friendly and helpful. Quiet (facing rear courtyard). Complained aircon barely coped with 30 degree C, only to discover second split system behind screen above wardrobe. Perfect central position. Easy walk to harbour and yet just outside mega-busy area.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Barcelona City”
Reviews.Author: Philippe B
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel at an unique location in the heart of Barcelona, near the placa Catalunya. Very authentic building with modern en comfortable room facilities. Here we will stay again when we visite Barcelona the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: glamazan
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at this hotel and found it worth every penny. The location was perfect; close to the metro, Gothic Quarter, Las Ramblas, shopping, etc. The rooms were clean, modern and with a decent size bathroom. We felt very safe with locking up our valuables in the room and there's always staff around to answer any questions. Highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WoodstockBird
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The Patio was a wonderful place to unwind between the day touring and going out for the evening. We would definately stay here again. It was clean and comfortable, and the staff were wonderful, and spoke very good English.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: Fabbo8
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights. I chose this hotel because of its location and the reviews and i wasnt disappointed. I was looking for a hotel close to Las Ramblas and this was perfect. We caught the aerobus straight to Place de Catalunya which is the last stop. It takes about 20mins from the airport. I did have a bit of trouble locating the hotel from the map but it was only about 5mins walk away. The hotel has a wonderful charm and atmosphere. We were able to check into our room early and had been upgraded to a larger room which overlooked the deck area. There is a lift. The room was large with two king single beds. There was a wardrobe with a safe, a comfy couch and a flatscreen tv hung on the wall. The linen was fresh and the bed comfy. The ensuite had a vanity, shower and toilet and all were very clean. Breakfast was included and was at the cafe next door but you could sit out in the open area opposite the hotel. There was a choice of breakfasts and although basic were nice and more than adequate. Staff were very helpful and we loved strolling around the area and Las Ramblas was just down the street and we thoroughly enjoyed our time there. We were sorry we hadn't booked to stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, check in early”
Reviews.Author: GinaZ41
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in September 2011, Thursday to Sunday morning, had reserved a standard room. Got there at around 5 pm only to be told that the only room left was on the first floor, right off the shared lounge, with a window that faced the back patio. For privacy sake, the window had a wooden 'fence' in front of it so patio guests could not look into the room. So the large window was actually just a view of a big, black wooden fence - hence, no sunlight. We asked to change rooms but the hotel was full. The room was gorgeous, but no window view and we did get woken up by people in the shared area, so we asked to change rooms for the next 2 nights and the only way possible was to pay extra, which we did. We got a lovely room on the 3rd floor facing Rambla Catalunya. That room was actually smaller, but still gorgeous details, and the balcony on the street was really nice. Just room to stand on the balcony, but still - great to people watch and get fresh air, and was still very quiet. Gorgeous hotel and great location. I would stay again, but check in early (like 2 pm) and be prepared to pay extra to get a window with a view.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: TOTravelgirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right on Las Ramblas. It's a gorgeous older building that has updated rooms to very chic and efficient. The single room is very small, but organized well to maximize space (if you only have one bag). It's clean and the staff is very helpful and welcoming. There is free internet in your rooms but unfortunately the signal was not strong enough to use on their beautiful deck, which was a great respite for the city at the end of the day. The single bed was super comfortable too. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A highly recommended hotel that REALLY, REALLY didn't live up to the hype....”
Reviews.Author: Oblongbiggles
Reviews.Content: We recently had a couple of nights at this hotel and needless to say after the title of this review, we were not impressed. Firstly, the website flashed up Showing off stylish rooms and beautiful green tiles at an affordable price! We were amazed. Then the booking process commenced and we found the rooms that apparently started at the low prices touted were not available. We soldiered on anyway thinking it looked good enough to stay there for the same price as The Claris we'd considered anyway for a bit of luxury. Done, booked. On our arrival we were happy to find the location to be very central and the lobby and hallways to be exquisite, it was looking so promising. Then we saw our room, the room we'd paid €218 for, turned out to be INCREDIBLY pokey. Rooms starting at €50? Cleaning cupboards? The next problem was that the bathroom STANK of mold. We called reception to alert them to this and see if we could change room but were pretty much told that it didn't smell!! It really did, why would we lie!? The small window in the room did little to ventilate and the massive monolithic console in the middle of the room dominated the entire space needlessly and was impossible to find anything in due to the 'subtle' lighting. There was no water provided in the room despite a letter from the management saying that there would be and to be honest, the staff were rather surly. Anyway, maybe we caught them on an off few days but the room was overpriced and unacceptable. If it had been at a lower price, fine, you get what you pay for. But what we paid for what we received? There are a ton of better places to spend ones money on in Barcelona. I'd suggest going to those places before being tricked by the flashy website. STYLE OVER SUBSTANCE IN FULL EFFECT.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location !!!”
Reviews.Author: AngPIM
Reviews.Content: I've been to Barcelona several times with friends, and I've stayed in hotels that have not convinced me. This time I decided to look for a better one not so expensive but in a good location. I found it thanks to my TripAdvisor's member update with the "Top 10 Boutique Hotels under $200". As my parents were travelling with me I was a little worried that the hotel would be too hip for their taste. But they loved it, the hotel is very chic, in an old historic building, with the best attractions around the corner and also great restaurants. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The hotel has a common area perfect to chill out and rest after been all day walking around Barcelona. We stayed in two very big rooms, very clean and with charming balconies overlooking the Rambla Catalunya. Overall for the price and location it is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Hugh C
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September 2010. The hotel is located about a 5 minute walk from the main tourist street of La Rambla. It was a great location within walking distance of all of the cities main sites and with public transportation close by as well. The rooms were perfect mix of modern but blending into the old world charm of the hotel. Our room had a large bathroom with floor to ceiling windows. The hotel was clean and the staff were quite friendly and able to give us must see recommendations as a trip to Barcelona was only 2 short days. I will gladly stay here again on my next trip to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice building, central location”
Reviews.Author: zigler
Reviews.Content: This was a very pleasant place to stay. Helpful staff (all spoke English and Spanish just fine- probably lots of other languages too, but I didn't try). The fact that you're in an old historic building is evident from the public spaces, which I thought were very tastefully maintained. The room seemed fairly new and was quite stylish. I was by myself, so I stayed in a single room, which was comfortable, but very very small. And the windows faced directly out to the next building, so there was no view whatsoever. Probably not the case in all the rooms. Even though there are tons of people out on the street at night quite late, I didn't hear them at all from my room. The price of the room seemed very reasonable compared to other options in this neighborhood. My guess is that every drawback I experienced had to do with the fact that I selected to stay in a small single room, and that these are not drawbacks of the hotel in general. I'd stay here again, but spring for a nicer room.

Reviews.Title: “In the right place!”
Reviews.Author: Purplemum337_11
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews for this hotel, and chose to stay here whilst in Barcelona based on them. We were not disappointed. The staff are friendly, helpful and charming. The rooms are cool, comfortable, and well appointed. The location is superb, just a very short walk from Placa de Catalunya. The eating places in the immediate surrounds are wonderful, beautiful hotel with lots of style. Our only problem, and it is minor, is that the Internet connectivity was difficult, and the connection kept dropping out. It wasn't computer related, as we didn't have this in other places. However, there is a computer provided in the lounge, so we used that for our urgent dealings, and enjoyed the cultural side of Spain instead of surfing!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Luv2TravelBookWorm
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel. Old decor with a modern twist. Chic design, comfortable beds and linens, pleasant rain shower head. Inner courtyard staircase is gorgeous. Despite being located on a bustling street, the double glazed windows made it a non-issue. Ask for an upper floor room facing the rambla de cataluna or the rear courtyard. We were originally in Room 108 and, while it is large with impressively tall ceilings, it is also on the ground floor next to the outdoor patio area which could be noisy at times. The staff were helpful, and were able to relocate us the next day. Side note: unbelievably good coffee at Cafe Hansel 5 blocks north. Similarly good coffee, pastries and sandwiches at Bopan 6 blocks north. Location: excellent. North of the plaza de cataluna and the start of la rambla. Easy walking distance to Casa Mila and Casa Batllo. Close to metro. Can't wait to go back. Happy Travels

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay, particularly if you don't need a full-service hotel”
Reviews.Author: DoomedXIII
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel in a great location, just blocks from the Barri Gotíc, with easy access to Metro and RENFE train stops. The private terrace is a great, usually quiet place to enjoy your goodies from La Boquería. Our balcony room was nice, but the balcony wasn't large enough to sit out on (though we could see chairs on the larger balconies for other rooms). Triple shutters helped to keep most of the street noise out. On the downside, the Wi-Fi was very flaky, especially in the room, less so on the terrace. The bathroom had a bit of a mildewy odor and the staff, though polite and professional, wasn't as warm and helpful as you might hope. Also, as others have observed, there are no in-room fridges or mini-bars. Overall, a nice place to stay, but if you're looking for more personal service or more amenities, you may want to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaGyrl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this centrally located, very modern hotel on the Ramblas as our first stop on our honeymoon. We were able to walk to most everything we wanted to see in Barcelona. Our balcony overlooked the street, which was particularly handy when we wanted to check out the goings on with the austerity protests going on while we were there. The service was friendly and helpful, especially when (because of the protests) our flight to San Sebastian was cancelled/postponed and we had to stay at Hotel Praktik an additional night. I would definitely stay here again. There was internet, which was a bit slow and limited, but better than nothing!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but quite expensive”
Reviews.Author: JulieMIsrael
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and were very impressed with the location. It was right on the Rambla and close to all attractions. Seeing the pictures on the sites made the hotel look very attractive and special and if truth be known it was very different from a usual hotel. Saying this, I think the rooms were extremely small and had no real cupboard apart from the end of the bed where you could sort of have your clothes stacked. I thought this was not a quirky idea and was not at all convenient. There was some juice served on the patio for a couple of hours a day but if you missed that then there was nothing at all! I would have thought it fitting to have both coffee and tea plus some cold water served constantly for the price we paid! Another thing that was not up to par was having one computer for public use. Quite often having to wait for an hour just to use it. When at last the computer was free one had to sit on the most uncomfortable poof type chair which sank down as you sat providing no support whatsoever. Agsin the hotel was special in appearance but certainly no big shakes.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel for an affordable price”
Reviews.Author: joonebug
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a single room for one night and I found the room to be small yet stylish. The twin bed took up most of the space but the modern and clever design elements complemented the room very well. Also, the high ceilings definitely helped to make the room feel less compact than its true size. The air conditioner did a good job cooling the room but it took some time for it to feel cold. The bathroom had a wonderful rainfall shower head and the hotel provided shampoo/soap by H20 by the sink. There were no closets so there's very limited space to hang any items although there were two wall hooks. They did have some under-the-bed storage but that was also limited. The only downside of my room was that the windows faced out into some type of outdoor hallway so they were kept shuttered. It was pitch black when the lights were off (almost like sleeping in a closet) but I discovered that it helped to crack open the shutter to allow some moonlight to come into the room. The hotel is very conveniently located near the Plaza Catalunya metro station (about 2 blocks) but it was definitely away from the noise and bustle of Las Ramblas. The common areas were beautiful - I found the terrace to be very inviting and spacious. It would be a wonderful place to relax with a cocktail after a day of sightseeing. The free wifi was spotty but there was a computer in the common area which was available for guests to check email and to surf the internet. I would definitely recommend this hotel to other visitors but I would suggest staying in one of the larger rooms. The single room is fine for a quick one night stay for one person but any longer and you may feel a little bit claustrophobic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - but charge for late check out”
Reviews.Author: janssem
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights in September and we booked the hotel because of the good comments on Tripadvisor. The location of the hotel is great: Many Restaurants and Bars are in walking distance. Also the Shopping district including the La Catedral is only a 10 minutes walk away. The only two minus points were that they charge you a late check out fee (50% of your room rate). This would cover the time from 12pm - 3pm. I understand that this is not a 400 bed room hotel, however I would expect a little more flexibility here. The other minus point was the inconsistency of the WIFI and Internet connection. During our stay at least 1,5 days the connection did not work and there was no sense of urgency to fix it. During our stay we were not the only guests complaining about it. Overall I would stay again but it would be nice to see both things taken care off.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and beautiful. Would definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: ESCNTraveller
Reviews.Content: Note: Stayed here in July 2010. Loved our room here! It was gorgeous: spacious, the decor and styling was fantastic, clean, had ample storage and floor length windows so you could invite the beautiful Barcelona sun into your room. Very centrally located to everything. Would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Stinky Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlabamaTravelbug123
Reviews.Content: My family stayed in this hotel 2 weeks before we arrived and said that the room smelled like sewage. That was our experience as well. There is obviously some plumbing issues going on here. The shower wouldn't drain properly. I had to get up in the middle of the night to close the bathroom door because of the very stong smell... it woke me up. Otherwise the staff was great and the hotel was beautiful. Location was excellent. We didn't bother to complain because we figured it wouldn't do any good.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STYLE!”
Reviews.Author: betinaepiphanio
Reviews.Content: We loved the time we spend there, it was wonderful! My mum was very happy to see Barcelona in such a great style, everything was really FINE. All the team was very nice , helpfull. Very near from Gaudi houses, really a gem! The only problema was the internet (didnt work well inside the room) I would stay there next year for sure! Betina/ Brazil

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: waideron
Reviews.Content: Clean, well kept, centrally located with friendly staff. Negatives would be no tea/coffee facilities in the room, breakfast is next door and wasn't great. Also no parking.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, staff and city.”
Reviews.Author: David R
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff. Lovely rooms and lounge area. Hotel ideally placed to explore the city and relax nearby in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty, clean, central!”
Reviews.Author: Transient-friend
Reviews.Content: Cute little hotel on Rambla de Catalunya - very central location. Near several tapas bars and night clubs, cocktail lounges etc. A short walk from Las Ramblas and the beach. It’s a quick stroll to couple of Gaudi buildings. The hotel is very close to large shopping areas. It is walking distance from the metro so you can explore more of Barcelona. The rooms may be small but somehow you don’t feel cramped. Our room had a high ceiling, and was tastefully painted and furnished. Very clean and neat. The hotel’s small atrium is actually quite pretty. There is a nice terrace to hang out on where they serve fresh juice. It’s a nice little place to chill out.

Reviews.Title: “Great city, beautiful building, poor hotel.”
Reviews.Author: gnomeaz
Reviews.Content: The reviews were very positive so we booked in for one night to try it out. The building is a good example of modernist architecture, with lovely interior details, and a very pleasant terrace on the first floor. The staff are pleasant though not particularly helpful. But the real downside of this hotel is the accommodation. The rooms are tiny with no room to turn around and no full length hanging space. They are clean and the hotel is quite well located, but for our money we decided to pay a little extra and stayed at the Roger de Lluria, which is better located and incomparably nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, impraktik shower”
Reviews.Author: Richard_Sear
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a 3 star hotel on a lovely street which is not too busy but has all the bars, restaurants etc you want, and is 2 mins from the Plaza Catalunya (with metro, local train connections, etc).
