It is in a lovely converted house with a beautiful stairwell, but the view from mine and I guess most rooms is very limited. The room is also small but very well fitted out, and modern. Despite the internet being down for my 1st evening it is probably my favourite (of 4) hotels in Barcelona - but if you want to shower without washing your hair, go elsewhere. For some reason the shower head is directly above the (well fitted out) cubicle and maybe 2.75 metres up (old building = high ceilings) so showering is like being in hot rain.

Reviews.Title: “Really fantastic location and value!”
Reviews.Author: Austraveller77180
Reviews.Content: Spot on location at the top of la rambla and just out of the hustle and bustle. Fantastic rooms and the price was amazing! The join to the bathroom was a little strange but in a couple would be fine (there were three of us). The only criticism is the staff.. They didn't really seem to have much local knowledge and were not super helpful with directions. Could do with some maps on hand and some training to help out guests.

Reviews.Title: “We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Praktik.”
Reviews.Author: Horseshack
Reviews.Content: We loved the central location and the hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The accommodation was excellent and we hope to return one day. We will recommend it to our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible hotel!”
Reviews.Author: charmingdelusion
Reviews.Content: We had 5 nights here in a twin room (traveling with a friend), and were amazed by how much space we had in the clean, cool, and modern hotel. The hotel is in a converted mansion, and the renovations are perfect. I wouldn't change a thing. The bed and linens were very comfortable, the closet space was generous (enough space for two women to empty their suitcases into!), and the rainshower head in the shower was simply divine. The location was perfect for our stay. It's right on Las Ramblas, but at the north end of it away from most of the street performers and vendors. Close enough to be part of the action, but far enough away to avoid the madness of Las Ramblas if you wanted to. The central location makes it perfect for those who love to walk from one end of the city to the other. We could easily head down to the beach, or to the great shopping area the Ravel area, or the oldest part of Barcelona, The Barri Gotic, or to experience the Modernista architecture in L'Eixample. The staff was always very helpful whether we needed suggestions, directions, or when we told them the shower drain was sluggish. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hotel was average”
Reviews.Author: MissTinaIrvine
Reviews.Content: After coming from the Me in Madrid, I was disappointed when I first saw our room at the Praktik Rambla. The room was small and the bed was not that comfortable. There is no refrigerator to store drinks and our terrace fit one chair. Although I was not totally happy with our room, there were a few advantages to staying here. The bathroom was nice, a bit small, but modern and clean. The room was also clean and quiet at night. There is an air conditioner in the room where you can control the temperature. The location was also great, a five minute walk to the busy part of Las Ramblas and close to great shopping. The staff was okay. Not overly friendly or rude. If I were to find myself in Barcelona again, I would probably stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jamiemcc
Reviews.Content: Was searching for the perfect hotel in Barcelona as I taking my wife to Bon Jovi at the Olympic Stadium for her 40th Birthday. After researching trip advisor I settled with this hotel as I was on a bit of a budget. Upon arrival we were very impressed with the location, just 5 minutes amble from Catalunya Place. The overall appearance was as expected from the photos and we were de Others with the architecture which was in keeping with the impressive surroundings. Our room was spacious with a balcony on to the main Rambla Avenue and the view was excellent. The bed was enormous and the bathroom was excellent too. Breakfast was included and was served outside on the Rambla which was fantastic as the sun was shining. This hotel is amazing value for money and we were delighted, the only slight negative was that the hotel did not have it's own bar or restaurant but being in the centre of Barcelona it was no inconvenience to us at all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location...Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Longhornz1
Reviews.Content: Recently left and returned from Barcelona on a 12 day Mediterrenean cruise. Would highly recommend this hotel! The Hotel in itself is a work of art!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasent stay!”
Reviews.Author: emmaearz
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in Hotel Praktik Rambla, Barcelona in July 2011. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay here. The location is great; it is really close to the famous street of La Rambla which is gorgeous to walk down! It is also close to the transport links and tourist open top bus stops. The hotel itself is really beautiful, it has amazing features: lovely high ceilings and unusual décor - it does not lack character one bit! It has an awesome terrace as well where you can hear the sounds of the busy city. Our room was lovely, the bed was HUGE, comfy and the bathroom had the biggest shower I had ever seen! The only downside was that our room was at the front of the hotel overlooking a busy street that never slept; there was noise throughout the night and it kept us awake! We had just travelled from Ibiza where we had spent most of our time time partying – we wanted to relax in Barcelona but we spent as much time awake in Barcelona as we did in in Ibiza! The staff were really lovely and helpful to us in the hotel and I’m sure if we mentioned or complained about our noisy room they would have moved us - but we aren’t ones to complain. The staff gave us some very good advice to ‘look after our belongings on la rambla’ this was probably to do with the amount pickpockets! I had my phone stolen out of my bag whilst being on La Rambla so remember to zip up your pockets and bags at all times! Mine wasn’t zipped up and someone took it without noticing! Bad times! Anyway! I would highly recommend this lovely hotel for its location, character and amazing staff!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Laboulenein
Reviews.Content: Hotel very nice and staff the best and very supportive. Would be great if they add a kettle and fridge. Would recommend it to anyone. The location is perfect that is for sure. Central yet not loud.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, fair hotel”
Reviews.Author: pieperhermosa
Reviews.Content: The hotel seemed pretty modern and was in a great part of town. Easily walked to the Rambla, the subway was nearby, lots of restaurants. However, the hotel room was tiny- barely enough room for the bed (it was a full bed at least- not twin beds pushed together) and there was no fridge. There was A/C but even on the highest setting it barely cooled the room down, even when we left it on all day! The bathroom was an okay size, for one person at a time. But the hotel staff was helpful. Overall, we were content with our stay there but next time we'd probably stay some where with a fridge, especially in the heat of the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and pleasant location.”
Reviews.Author: Darwin1859
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in Barcelona before proceeding to Zaragoza and then on to Valencia, so I was looking for a hotel which was in a good central position, a nice area, clean, not too big, with friendly staff and reasonably priced. As far as the Praktik Rambla was concerned I could tick all those boxes. Other pluses were the hotel is in a building which seems to be historically important, and the funky interior decor nicely compliments the Art Deco style of Gaudi's Barcelona. The only quibble I have was that I thought the breakfast would have been served in the hotel, instead I had to go outside to have it where it was offered by the bar next door, it was ok but no frills. At least I got to watch the people walking by as I ate! If you're on a short visit to Barce I would recommend this hotel as the location is excellent and the area in which it is situated is very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Cool little hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: lizilicious524
Reviews.Content: The Praktik Rambla is in a nice spot, not too far from the old city center where there are lots of shops and restaurants and nightlife, but also up a little bit so not too far from all the modernisme buildings in L'Eixample. It is also pretty conveniently located in terms of metro and bus stops, for getting to airport/train and sites farther out from the center of town. The room was small but pleasant and clean. The only downsides were that it never got quite as cool as we'd like even with the AC all the way up, and the shower drain would back up when we took showers right after each other, so that the second person would have some standing water in the shower by the end. This might have been because my husband preferred to use soap rather than the provided shower gel, but if so that is a design flaw with the drain! There is a little cafe right across the street where we got a good value breakfast every morning and could sit outside and people watch. Overall, we definitely enjoyed the location and ambiance and just made do with a few small inconveniences.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, but doesn't quite live up to the raving reviews”
Reviews.Author: BoywonderTo
Reviews.Content: We booked the Praktik Rambla because of all the great reviews here, and were really looking forward to staying here. I thought this was a decent hotel, but I don’t think it lives up to all the raving reviews. The location of the hotel was quite perfect. It is just north of the most touristy area of Barcelona, which makes it very convenient but also not as chaotic/messy as the area south of it. It is also a block away from a metro interchange station (with multiple lines) and three blocks form a Rodalies station on the R2 line (i.e. frequent and direct trains to airport and Sitges, two of our destinations). One of our key criteria was to be close to the gay bars/clubs (so we can drag our tired a**es home in the middle of the night/early in the morning without too much hassle) and this hotel was perfect for that. Being close to the gay area also means that there are tons of nice/trendy restaurants nearby that less touristy. The front desk staff were friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. Though since it is a small boutique hotel it usually only has one staff member at the front desk. This means if there is a chatty client (or someone who did not do their travel research) in front of you, you might be waiting for a long while. The housekeeping staff can be a bit more attentive (the bathroom counter was dusty when we got there; we ran out of shower gel and were not given more for two days), but nothing too major to complain about. We stayed in standard double rooms. There were two legs to our trip so we stayed in two different rooms that were very similar. While I appreciate that the hotel boosts that “less is luxe”, the rooms are too minimalistic in my view (and I am someone who usually appreciate chic and simple). There are certain basic functional features that are missing, such as a desk, a chair, an alarm clock, a small fridge, a closet, an ice bucket, etc. The rooms were trendy and well decorated, but they were really small (even without the aforementioned furniture).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and room.”
Reviews.Author: kccruisers
Reviews.Content: Praktik Rambla was an ideal hotel for us. We were close to all of the things we needed and just a couple blocks from the busiest part of Las Ramblas. Just a couple blocks from the metro also so it was easy for us to get to Sagrada Familia and the funicular to Montjuic. It is a lovely little hotel with large rooms and nicely appointed bathrooms. The hotel staff was very helpful whenever we had a question. There was also free internet available. We will stay there again the next time we are in Barcelona and we are recommending it to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel at budget price- just fix that extra bed ok?!?”
Reviews.Author: synnae
Reviews.Content: I was travelling with friends who had never been to BCN before and only had limited time. I myself prefer to stay in Gracia, a less touristy, more alternative neighborhood. This hotel is a great find. It is very affordable, located perfectly and renovated lovely. Location is perfect for a touristy visit to Barcelona. Walking distance of metro stations Passeig de Gracia (airport train) and next to Placa de Catalunya (airport bus). You are very close to all the hustle and bustle but far away not to suffer its negative effects (drunk tourists, massive tour groups). Rambla de Catalunya is a shopping street with good stores, but less busy than its neighbour Passeig de Gracia. We were a party of three so booked a double with extra bed. This hotel is spacious and easily accommodate such a request. Sadly the quality of the 3rd bed is crap and makes for a sleepless night. It is the one fault I have with this hotel. The hotel looks like a funky boutique hotel, yet is priced very reasonable, especially for its location. We had one of the very spacious rooms at the back of the hotel, overlooking the court yard with the massive green bathroom. You don't get a view of the street nor have a balcony but it does get you a really quiet room. Bed was large and very comfortable. AC was working perfectly. Digital flat screen TV had English language channels (rare in Spain for a ** hotel). Shower is wonderful too. Breakfast is not had in the hotel but in the bar/restaurant next to it. The free wifi reception in the room was a bit iffy, and at times only worked well near the door or in the hall way. But the hotel also has a free pc all guests can use, which is very handy for flight check-ins etc. Hotel also offer luggage storage, with a ticket for your luggage items as an extra safety check. Now, my big hang-up (as you can tell from my title) is their spare bed. You'd think a futon couch would be one mattress. Sadly not. It were separate pillows held together with unpadded fabric. Which meant that as the couch is not completely flat when unfolded you roll towards the middle, end up on the unpadded fabric and consequently onto the metal frame. Obviously, that means you don't sleep well. After our complaint staff did offer us another room straight away (the smaller regular double room with the balcony) but that too had a similar separate pillow mattress going. So we decided as everything else was great to suck it up and take turns sleeping on it. Seriously, hotel Pratik, go to IKEA, buy their cheapest futon, problem solved.

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD HOTEL WOULD STAY AGAIN !!”
Reviews.Author: jsp55red
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutley superb. We booked this some time ago for our weekend city break which we take every year in June. The directions to the hotel were not so good so it did take us some time to find it. Once we found it the directions however they did make sense. The hotel staff were very very friendly, the hotel was immaculately clean and it was a nice mix of modern and traditional interiors. The bathroom in our room was lovely and the showering area was superior to other hotels we have stayed in as it had a power shower with overhead drencher. The room was a little small but everything else about the hotel more than compensated for it. They outdoor rooftop balcony was a definate plus point and we enjoyed drinks on there both before and after our evenings out. There was a restaurant next door and the hotel had an arrangement with them for breakfast. We were given vouchers for breakfast and on both mornings sat outside which was lovely. I was suprised to be offered english breakfast as in all other european cities we have visited it has been continental only so again this was a plus point. We had extra coffee one morning which we expected to pay for but they would not accept payment. The staff were also very friendly in the restaurant. The position of the hotel was excellent for getting around the city. I would definalty stay here again if I visited the city it was close enough to the ramblas but also far enough way as to not to be to noisy of an evening. We did not feel threatend by pick pockets but you do need to be careful on the Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Praktik Rambla”
Reviews.Author: Terrier52
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 days pre-cruise in late May and had a wonderful time. We arrived early and our room wasn't ready. The staff allowed us to leave our baggage and we took off exploring Barcelona which is a geat city. We opted for the more expensive WOW room and are glad we did. The room was spacious, king bed comfortable and the bathroom lovely with lots of hot water and pressue. Our room had two small balconies that overlooked the street. I wished there was a chair on the balcony to sit but we spent so little time in the room it didn't matter. The staff is wonderful. They were helpful and pleasant. We had left our jackets in the closet and didn't realize until several days after we departed. They so kindly and efficiently arranged to have them sent to our home. The Aerobus goes from the airport to the Plaza Catalunya which is only a few short blocks from the hotel. Taxis are right outside the hotel so we did not have hail any on the street or call to get to the cruise port. The metro is right down the streets and the buses are one block over. The neighborbood is safe, beautiful and convenient to everywhere. Restaurants and breakfast eateries abound. The only thing lacking is ice. We will definitely come again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: yulestar2001
Reviews.Content: Could not recommend Hotel Praktik Rambla strongly enough. Awesome location on the right side of the city. The rooms were old-style and very classy. The staff were polite and most helpful. Rates were very reasonable. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel. Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: statt
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located out of the mayhem of Las Ramblas but close to everything. The renovation of the building is exquisite; the blend of old and new is perfect. The roof garden is a haven after sightseeing all day and we wish we had had more time to enjoy it. The beds are super comfy and the bathrooms are terrific. A big flat screen TV and free Wifi were very welcome. Breakfast taken at the restaurant next door is good value and it is very pleasant sitting outside in fine weather. We also had a quick dinner there one night before going to the theatre and really enjoyed it. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place, excellent service, great value”
Reviews.Author: krdonley
Reviews.Content: We stayed a total of three nights in the hotel. The place was simple and just what we were looking for. It has an excellent location between between the old and new city. The staff was wonderful and the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nicholb
Reviews.Content: This is a really unique hotel and was a joy to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “I'm coming back to Barcelano & I won't stay at any other place”
Reviews.Author: giftedmermaid
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fantastic. All the people the worked there were genuinely friendly and helpful. I came from a week long training camp & straight into Barcelona. When I arrived with my 60 pound bag with broken wheels, I needed a quiet room and that's exactly what I got. My single room had an amazing shower! Most 4 & 5 star hotels in the states don't have the shower that I had.. The room clean crisp and comfortable. The hotel is perfectly located on the Las Rambla for site seeing, walking or catching the hop on hop off bus. I booked the hotel as a last resort & wished I could have stayed there the whole time. I had to book a hotel across the street for my last 2 nights. It was more expensive and had none of the charm, personality or friendly staff that the Hotel Praktik had! Also, The wifi in the room worked perfectly and it was no extra charge. Hotel across the street was 10 Euros a day extra. I wasn't a big fan of the restaurant that works with the hotel.. but that was not an issue for me. I'll be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Super modern hotel + great location”
Reviews.Author: philippe_grimard
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just like I expected. Super nice room design and great location. Seriously, I consider myself as a picky person and Iwas not disapoointed at all, neither was my girlfriend. I would definitevely recommand this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we expected...”
Reviews.Author: kimjackson
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on other positive reviews on this site and others. We were not dissappointed either (as you can be once you have had alot of good feedback!!). This was my husband's first visit to Barcelona and my fourth. The location is unbeatable really, only a walk to many places of interest - in fact we saw the Old Town, the Rambla, La Boqueria market, Casa Mila, Sagrada Familia and La Pedrera on foot. (We like to walk and don't consider it too far to walk 15-30 minutes or so to get somewhere...) And since Barcelona's public transport is so cheap and easy to use, we took buses for Park Guell and the metro for Montjuic, Barcelonetta and etc.. We spent our first night in Spain after long haul from Australia at this hotel and found it very comfortable - we had a front room with two small balconies and didn't mind the "noise" as some other reviewers have stated. I think if you aren't expecting a little street noise on one of the most major streets in Barcelona, you are choosing the wrong hotel. For me, that constant hum drum into the wee hours is part and parcel of being in Spain and living the life there! That said, when we left for Madrid at 630 am, there was not a soul on the street, bar a few taxi drivers, so it is a place where you can be right in the centre AND get a good night's sleep. Just stick to the Spanish rhythm! We would return here - VERY good value for money, some good hotels in Barcelona are VERY expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Stay”
Reviews.Author: mikeriggs
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for two nights and absolutely loved it. The staff was extremely helpful and the hotel itself was beautiful. We stayed on the second floor with a balcony that overlooked the outdoor sitting area. The room was size was more than adequate with gorgeous details from the tile floor to the rain shower. The location is about two to three blocks north of La Rambla which comes out to be a short five minute walk. We were also able to walk to the Gaudi museum and the Sagrada from the Praktik. There are plenty of places to eat right outside the front door of the hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel as its far enough away from the Rambla to avoid the crowds but close enough to get to if thats what you're after. It's a beautiful small hotel and it really helped us to enjoy our time in Barcelona. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Barcelona. Thanks for the great stay.

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: toni1056
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved this hotel. Our room was very nice. We had a balcony overlooking the street. Although we were right above the main street it was not loud there at all. The staff was also very helpful whenever we asked them any questions. The only thing I would change is to have a chain lock on the door or some kind of do not disturb sign. We had the housekeeping come in once while we were having our siesta. One big perk is the location of this hotel. It's right next to Las Ramblas and easily accessible by bus from the airport. It is also next to the tour bus route so you can see everything right from your doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “hotel with its history”
Reviews.Author: Vesnushka
Reviews.Content: the building of this hotel was a house of the Catalonian bourgeoisie. be ready to be impressed with the special style & interior design of every floor of hotel. it is small but charming, well renovated, clean, quite. I have stayed with my husband, our first night we've spent in a very tight room, with limited daylight and terrible smell. moreover, it was very cold there as there are no heating in hotel - just air-conditioning that doesn't help much. We complained to the receptionist on the next day, so got free upgrated to double superior room which we found very beautiful, spacy, comfortable. The room has a private terrace! I would love to stay at this hotel again, but I will make sure I book the double superior room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service, cool, hip rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Yankeetraveller057
Reviews.Content: I'm 57 years old and loved the cool vibe of the room, we stayed in room #404, had a great view of the street, the double windows kept most of the street noise out, only a few drunks out at 5:00 in the morning. The restaurants on both sides of the hotel are bad, so don't bother. But, back to the room, the lighting could be better, here again it could be my age, had to put my makeup on by the balcony, also no refrigerator for beers & wine, problem solved, go to the El Cortez and buy a cheap cooler, on the 4th fl and ice on the bottom floor, the El Cortez is located on the Placa Catlunya. As, for coffee Starbucks 1 1/2 blocks down the street. Casa Batllo is worth the time and money, and very close to the hotel. For day trips you can't beat the Dali museum, Montserrat, or Blanes. For Blanes, buy your train ticket in the metro at Placa Catulunya, it's a 2 hour trip, then you get on the bus ( ticket includes the bus) and it takes you into the town, head to the beach and you'll see the boats that take you to Tossa de Mar. I hope to return soon. p.s. the staff is great

Reviews.Title: “Chic Hotel in a Terrific Location!”
Reviews.Author: lordoftheonionrings
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a five day stay in this hotel, and definintely recommend it to anyone looking for a place to stay in Barcelona. The hotel is located two blocks from the Plaza Catalunya, which is a main square in the city, off of which is located much of the best shopping and eating in the city, the areas called Passeig de Gracia and las Ramblas. The Aerobus leaves from the airport every 10-15 minutes, and will take you right to the Plaza Catalunya. I would not recommend this if you have a lot of heavy bagagge, since you will need to pull your suitcases about two city block, but it worked well for us. There are many amazing shops and restaurants just minutes from the hotel, and it is located in one of the most walking-friendly areas of Barcelona, with a few of Gaudi's most famous buildings within a 20-minute walk from the hotel. The waterfront area is about a 30-minute (pleasant) walk from the hotel, and only a couple of metro stops away. The hotel is just a half block from a central metro station, and we had no trouble getting around the city from there easily. The rooms at Praktik Rambla are beautiful. We had a large exterior room with a huge bedroom with 15" ceilings and one of the nicest bathrooms I've seen in a European hotel. We had huge windows overlooking the hotel courtyard, with lots of natural light. Unfortunately, the room didn't have a mini-fridge, but we were able to keep a couple of necessities in the fridge at the reception desk. Overall, this is a great hotel with a friendly staff, and incredibly well situated in Barcelona. I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “lovely rooms, good service,great location”
Reviews.Author: allybeeLancaster
Reviews.Content: 4 of us stayed here on a girls' trip in early May.The hotel is located near the Placa Catalunya, a stone's throw from Passeig de Gracia and not far from the top of the Ramblas.The rooms and external shared areas are really beautiful with tasteful lamps, sofas, & comfortable beds. The bathrooms are very clean and quite newly done. We stayed in rooms 108 and 109 so we benefited from the outside terrace right outside our room. A little noise at night but nothing excessive. The only word of warning if travelling with a friend not a spouse-the bathroom has very little privacy,so you need to know each other well, and the beds are not twins, but large doubles with separate mattresses.This didn't bother us, and we found the staff hepful and friendly, and the breakfast next door was fine

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, spacious and suites families!”
Reviews.Author: ElisaLehti
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Praktik Rambla for 6 nights in April 2011. We are a family of four, parents + two children under 10. We had a room for two, a WOW! room that is bigger than the others, with one extra bed. The beds were wide enough to fit 2+2 or even 3+1. The hotel was located perfectly when arriving from the airport. The airport bus stops close by. There are also a lot of nice restaurants in the neighborhood. We had high hopes on the hotel after reading good reviews from TripAdvisor, and the Hotel amazingly lived up to all our hopes! It was great to have a "private" terrace (for all hotel guests, but no one but our family seemes to enjoy it) for ourselves in the middle of the city - especially helpful when travelling with kids. And most importantly - the rooms were quiet so we all slept well! We were very pleased with our stay and will absolutely revisit Praktik Rambla if we come to Barcelona again!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we wanted!”
Reviews.Author: joyceOttawa
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, the building itself is beautiful, the reception desk people were very helpful and pleasant. We loved our black and white room with a terrace. The free wifi was much appreciated. It is an ideal location from which to explore Barcelona. I wish we could have stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel with perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Maunolito
Reviews.Content: We booked standard room and got a room number 211, it was small with a view through small window to a crampy backyard. Don't be fooled by the pics on the internet, as all the standard rooms are small. We were travelling with a baby, so we complained and the friendly receptionist upgraded us into room 404. It was definately a better one, with big windows to Ramba and two balconies. So if you have the budget or bargaining power, go for the superior. Hotel has no breakfast and the one where they offer vouchers is pretty basic and lacs any feeling (costs 7,5 eur). Rather go to the cafe next to Starbucks on Rambla de Cat. Service was excellent when we were changing rooms, otherwise basically non-existent. Basically you get a room and thats it. However, they do provide umbrellas if it happens to be rainy! Location could not be better and the hotel building has some real character.

Reviews.Title: “Such a beautiful, well located hotel with friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Scarabaeusblau
Reviews.Content: We stayed there only for 2 days and when I saw the room I wished I booked 2 weeks. Because it was really my living dream. The painting in black needs getting used to, but it fits. We had a wonderful quite room with a big terrace. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location was perfect, not that many trouble like in the "ramblas" but so central in the middle of barcelona that you can walk in each direction and don't need to take the bus or metro. The area around the hotel is very nice and there are good people who are living and working there. When I come back to Barcelona I will definitely stay in the PraktikRambla. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Service wanting”
Reviews.Author: DoreenJudyHannah
Reviews.Content: A rather short stay in Barcelona, 12 to 14 April 2011. Picked this lovely hotel for its great location, encircled between Paseig de Garcia train/metro station and Catalunya central station, in the upmarket Rambla Catalunya as opposed to the notorious La Ramblas. Praktik Ramblas is estheically pleasing, an old building but the interior was beautiful, the lift, the lights, the floor tiles, the huge doors. However, what was very disappointing was the service. The receptionists were not welcoming and not helpful. We had a triple room, and there was no housekeeping to lay out the 3rd bed for the evening. They gave us 3 bedsheets, 1 pillowcase with a hole, but no pillow, self service. The hotel doesnt come cheap for a 3 star rating, we probably were paying for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, attentive staff and wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: TexasLooie
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in suite 302, a superior suite with balcony, and it was a delight. Rooms are not large but more than adequite in the catergory we chose. The staff was very helpful with reccommendations and restaurants and using public transportation to get arount the city easily. Withing a few blocks there are numerous good eathing places, most with outside eating options in addition to inside. The Rambla is a wonderful place to eat outside and enjoy the sights and sounds. We were impressed with the fact that even with the noise of the Rambla when we closed our shutters, doors and curtains the sounds did not disturb out sleep at all. The style of the building is worth staying at this hotel - beautiful tile floors, marble walls in the halls, etc. We definatley would return if we again visit Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: SMartyn
Reviews.Content: This hotel could not have been better located for our first trip to Barcelona. It's in the smart and stylish Eixample district, just moments from all the beautiful modernista buildings. A short stroll in the opposite direction plunges you into the Old Town; walk right through it to the sea front. Everything we needed was on the doorstep - excellent cafes, tapas bars and restaurants. On the couple of occasions we wanted to go a little further afield the hotel staff were very knowledgeable about the best way to get there using the excellent metro and bus systems. The reception at the hotel is staffed by young people with excellent English who are unfailingly helpful and friendly - great ambassadors for this beautiful city. Don't bother buying the breakfast voucher though. Better and cheaper to put together your own breakfasts at the tapas bar next door.

Reviews.Title: “Original decor and convenient location for business or leisure”
Reviews.Author: ontheotherside
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Praktik Hotel on Rambla Catalunya a couple of times and enjoyed it. The rooms and the common areas of the building have character and the location is great. If you come in winter, plan to take your PJs and a sweater for the evening, as the heating in the rooms is quite poor (which also means you will freeze after a shower). Apart from this, the hotel is comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, ideal base for city trip!”
Reviews.Author: Sar00
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay in this stylish, quiet hotel. Room was comfortable with a large bed. Good and clean shower. Free WiFi, though unfortunately it worked on only 1 of our 2 devices. Nearest metro-station is just a block away, and the Placa Catalunya and Ramblas are within walking distance. Absolutely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: MTjernlund
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through the "Top 10 Barcelona" guide by Eyewitness Travel and it was way beyond our expectations. A gorgeous old mansion, now a boutique hotel, it's located in the heart of Barcelona, so we were able to walk everywhere or quickly grab the Metro around town. The front desk staff were very friendly, engaging, and helpful. The rooms were big, very clean, with bathrooms that were spacious and light. Lots of windows and high ceilings kept the rooms airy. The quality of everything was of the highest level. The restaurant right next door had wonderful breakfasts. I heartily recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Barcelona. You can't beat the quality and the price was extremely reasonable. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Best room ever - 209!”
Reviews.Author: bloxwich1956
Reviews.Content: Really loved this hotel, which is unique in that in converting it, they have left the orginal, beautiful 19thC building intact, with its fabulous, original modernist entrance hall, French windows, painted tiled floors, ceiling decorations etc. I had 209, the biggest and best room, with a lovely semicircular terrace overlooking the inner courtyard garden below , huge high ceilings and an enormous double bed. I think there were 1-2 single mattresses in there too! My only negative - I was travelling alone on business, so had no-one to invite to party on the terrace!. Staff were very helpful and professional too, and it's in a great central location.

Reviews.Title: “Run, don't walk, away from this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Wawafont
Reviews.Content: Probably one of those worst hotels I've even been to. A two star hotel at best. Had to switch rooms twice because rooms smelled like sewage. Pleasant. Got upgraded to a bigger room. Manager was nice about it. The man in the green tie at the front desk was not helpful or nice at all. Only thing good about hotel was the location. Not worth what we paid for room.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Hotel - trendy and old style all in one! Loved it”
Reviews.Author: John_Henry1975
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel in a great location - far enough from the Ramblas to be a bit quieter but only 5 mins walk away. Stunning old building (supposedly with Gaudi links) that has been converted brilliantly to a trendy boutique hotel. Room was very clean and bathroom was excellent - i want one! Highly recommend it and not too expensive considering its in the middle of one of Europes most beautiful cities.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with a difference!”
Reviews.Author: Alan48
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a converted tenement building to a high standard with many of the original features. Consequently, unless you got a front or back room you had no view from your window. Such was ours. I reckon you could swing a cat but it would just touch each wall on the way around. The TV had loads of channels, unfortunately none were english. The ubiquitous CNN was there but a half hour was more than a normal person could stand. Electricity fusebox kept blowing due to faulty extractor fan but as long as you kept the bathroom light off you could keep the light on in the bedroom. On the plus side, the hotel fronted onto an extension of Las Ramblas which was excellent for cafes and transport. The only we saw were on the front desk. They were most friendly and helpful. A pleasant stay despite the rainy weather.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: clairebo
Reviews.Content: I wanted to add my review to the many other positive things people have to say about Praktik Rambla. We stayed for three nights and had the most perfect time. Everyting about the hotel lived up to expectation: the location is safe and ideal; the service was friendly and efficient; the wifi worked all the time; the bed was huge and exceptionally comfortable (especially the pillows). Also I have to point out in particular that this one of the cleanest, if not the actual cleanest, hotels I have ever stayed in (and I've stayed in loads throughout the world). All in all our stay at the Praktik enhanced the wonderful time we had in Barcelona. I can't recommend it highly enough!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: barrancas1
Reviews.Content: First of all - perfect location. In the centre on city, near Catalunia Sq. But on the very quiet street, so you will be not disturbed by car or people noise. Next point - atmosphere and rooms. This hotel is not standart coridors and rooms. Its like a very big flat on each floor, with lounge zone, library, terrace and few bedrooms. Of course in the room you will have all own facilities as shower and wc, aircon, etc... In the warm weather you can go to terrace directly from the room. As for other benefits - clean! really clean and very tidy, no problem with hot water (temperature, pressure), normal (I mean - modern) fan in bathroom, big beds and room was also quite big. Probably only one moment a bit inconvenient - no frig (but we didn't need it and so it was not a problem during our stay). And second one - sometimes it was cold in room, aircon couldn't heat it. But anyway!!!! We liked this place, really enjoyed our staying and will recommend this hotel to friends!

Reviews.Title: “We Loved the Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Danimed
Reviews.Content: Great Cost x Benefit relation. The location is perfect, safe, next to everything you want to see and go to. The staff was very kind, the hotel was clean and the rooms were nice. Some guests were a bit too noisy, but that cannot be blamed on the hotel. Last but not least, WiFi worked very well. Two restaurants right beside the hotel, belonging to the same chain. One of them serves a light breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for almost any part of central Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: plymouth
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked because of previous Trip Advisor reviews. We were not disappointed; particularly, as we were upgraded from single to double rooms. What might not be too clear is that the natural light in the bedrooms comes from a central 'well' and, consequently, some guests may find the room a little claustrophobic. It should not be a concern for most. The architectural details of the original building are wonderful and the modern design style only complements it. Breakfast is taken next door at Piscolabis. We only tried the Continental Breakfast but that was fine. The staff there, as at the hotel, are great and very helpful. Clearly, it depends on where you wish to visit in Barcelona but this hotel is really well-placed. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Pratik...Central...Fantastic..”
Reviews.Author: Andre_Martins__
Reviews.Content: i really recommend pratik rambla...so simple to stay so easy to get in anywhere u want in barcelona!!!

Reviews.Title: “It was a perfect cosy hotel...”
Reviews.Author: acece
Reviews.Content: It was really a perfect and cosy hotel. The rooms designed attractevely and large enough. The staff was very kind and helpful. I can't talk about breakfast since we didn't take it. The locatios is very very good, on the luxury Rambla Catalunya which is very close to plaça de catalunya and las ramblas. I suggest to alones and group of friends...

Reviews.Title: “Great value for Location, Decor, Staff, etc.”
Reviews.Author: jenndoh
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights. The staff was warm, friendly and all spoke english. Everyone was very helpful and accomodating. The rooms was decorated nicely and not your typical hotel decor, which was a nice change. Nice high ceilings and had a great view overlooking the street. The hotel itself is in a beautifully maintained building with great architecture. The outside patio was very relaxing. Room very was clean. As some other reviewers stated, it is a great location with being close to Las Ramblas and Plaza Catalunya, Metro stops, restaurants, etc. Yet as the same time it is far enough way from the madness. We only paid 79 euros a night which I think was a great deal. We wouldn't hestitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Base For A Weekend Break”
Reviews.Author: arnoldthecat
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly just north of Placa Catalunya, close enough to lbars and restaurants and to walk easily to all the sights but far enough away from the frantic noise of the Ramblas / Old Town. The building is beautifully restored and the rooms are sparse but stylish. There is not a great deal of space but if you're planning to be there just to sleep this won't be a problem, and the bathroom was spacious and well equipped. The outdoor terrace and large lounge are both really lovely spaces. The terrace especially will be a welcome delight if visiting in the summer. All in all a stylish, well located and good value choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: tallskinnymatt
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed this hotel and couldn't find any obvious faults. Very generous sized room with funky if not slightly weird decor. The location couldn't be any better and the room was very quiet and comfortable. Nice staff, good wifi, found out late in our stay that the restaurants next door are excellent as well. Will stay here again given the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and price for value!”
Reviews.Author: serpiente_7
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel based on the comments at Trip Advisor and were happy to do so, as they were very accurate. We opted to pay the extra 30 euros for a double room overlooking the street. Believe me it was more than worthwile!! Our room was big, with a small balcony, high ceilings, a couch and a huge bed. The shower was fantastic but there seems to exist as others have previously noted a ventilation issue. It did not smell nice and we were obliged to have the windows almost continuously open. It was not a problem for us as the weather was fantastic but what if it ain't so? Note to light sleepers. There is indeed a lot of noise coming from the street even during the wee hours so you might skip the view and go for the back and quieter rooms. We did not mind the absence of a breakfast as there are tons of cafes nearby, however, we would have appreciated some in-room coffee-tea facilities. In general,the price of the hotel in relation to its atmosphere, architecture and good vibes was unbeatable for us. We were so close to everything and loved our stay in Barcelona because of this nice boutique hotel. We had breakfast at el Quim de La Boqueria, sitting on a stand with locals and drinking wine at 11.am like they did, had excellent tapas and fried artichokes to die for at Ciudad Condal and late afther hours drinks at Piscolabis which was next to the hotels entrance. Loved, loved, loved Barcelona!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great ambiance, great staff, great bed, but skip the breakfast...”
Reviews.Author: andybullock77
Reviews.Content: Stayed here early 2010. In a convenient location, I found this hotel quite impressive visually, given the price we had paid. Upon entering, it felt as though we'd found somewhere special at a budget price. It has a delicious ambiance created in part by the bare stone walls and patterned tiles in the reception area and corridors. The staff were very helpful, and whoever was on reception was always happy to make recommendations about local restaurants and bars, and give directions and maps. The building is lovely with the old and the modern combined well. Our room was a decent size, and came with a balcony overlooking the street. The bed was comfortable and of a large size. So what were the down sides? Let's start with breakfast. We'd paid for breakfast to be included. The hotel itself does not have a restaurant, but you are given a ticket to take to the tapas restaurant right next door, who then provide the breakfast. On the first day we decided to see what their take on an English breakfast was. First, we were brought a plate with two rashers of bacon forming a cross (Flag of St George maybe??), with two underfried eggs sat on top. Then, a kind of sandwich made from ciabatta and containing one thin, continental sausage. Oh, and orange juice and coffee. Not good. It seemed that they were trying too hard to be 'gourmet' about the whole thing. The next day, we decided to try the continental option. This consisted of a pastry (croissant or pain au chocolat), the same drinks as before, and a choice of a ham and cheese sandwich or an egg and potato omlette (which also came in a sandwich?). The continental was also supposed to come with a yoghurt, but we were told they had none left, and no alternative was offered. It's not a major gripe, but when you've paid extra for something, you expect it to be of a decent standard,and frankly I'd have been disappointed even if the breakfast was included in the room price. Another problem was the wi-fi, we had problems connecting all of the time during our stay, however there was a computer in the pleasant lounge area for public use. The hotel is close to Las Ramblas, a great place for tapas restaurants, bars, and La Boqueria market. Public transport including the metro is widely available from this area to other parts of the city. I'd certainly recommend the hotel to others, but I'd steer away from paying for the breakfast, just go out and find something from one of the local cafes etc. Oh, there's no minibar or fridge in the rooms, which I always find to be a minor drawback as I appreciate being able to store a couple of beers or soft drinks for in-room consumption. Despite the minor drawbacks, I liked the atmosphere so much I still have to give this place 4 stars, which is probably fair if I ignore the breakfast situation. Ask for a front-facing room, the view of the streets below and the surrounding landscape is great.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely quiet hotel subtly hidden away on a busy Barcelona street”
Reviews.Author: talltraveller27
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Praktik Rambla for 9 nights in December 2010. We were at the tail end of a European adventure and were keen for a quiet, comfortable hotel to use as a base to explore the food delights of Barcelona. Praktik Rambla certainly delivered that for us. We had an extra large room on the third floor, with a small balcony overlooking Rambla de Catalunya, with great views up and down the street, and although we had some of the noise from the busy street, the room had enough doors/shutters to block most of it out. We loved the comfy bed (possibly the largest bed I have ever slept in), and the big shower. We spent a lot of time in the room recovering from all the food and wine Barcelona had to offer, and we were glad of the amenities in the extra large room. The rest of the hotel was quite elegant, with an amazing internal space around the lift/staircase and a great little library/lounge area leading to an outdoor patio. We occasionally chilled out here with a travel book or drink pre/post-daily adventures. The hotel must have been quite empty when we were there, we didn't see too many other guests in these areas. The staff were consistently friendly and helpful, with a "Hola!" every time we walked past. We greatly appreciated our helpful welcome, complete with a local map and indication of the nearest landmarks (and a few questions about Australia). The front desk was also very accommodating when we needed to extend our stay by a night due to snow in London delaying our flight out of Barcelona, we were even able to stay in the same room. The only downside on the service was the maid/cleaning service, which was a bit erratic on which towels they replaced/didn't replace, and was sometimes finishing quite late in the afternoon when we were returning from our travels. We would definitely look to stay at Praktik Rambla again if we return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: davidn59
Reviews.Content: Had two rooms for family of five. The one at the front of building could be a little noisy, but to be expected given the location on a busy street. And the location is excellent, surrounded by restaurants and shops, a few minutes walk from Las Ramblas, metro and buses. Like some others we arrived early and only had access to one room (that's fair enough) but were not advised when the second room was ready and had a frustrating but unnecessary wait when it had been ready for some time. The building and the way it has been converted is interesting in its own right. Good-size rooms. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful building in a perfect spot”
Reviews.Author: amandamanning8
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an amazing building with such beautiful character. We stayed in room 401 which was at the back of the hotel. The rooms are small but done beautifully . The decor is very modern and the bathrooms are amazing with the most amazing shower !! Lovely clean white bedding and towels are provided. The staff are fully converse in English with a very happy attitude. The hotel is in an ideal spot with just a 10 minute stroll to the main hub of Barcelona with the airport bus stopping just 5 mins away. The area is safe with lots of lovely bars and cafes right on the doorstep.However, in the early hours of the morning the noise in the corridor from people walking on the stone floors is unbearable and also the banging of other bedroom doors. this is such a shame because otherwise it would be the perfect place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, stylish, well located hotel.”
Reviews.Author: magrit3
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel over the internet and found that the rooms were exactly as depicted. Situated in excellent position, central to all the restaurants, shops and the Rambla. A very old building renovated to include many of the original features. Ther was an outside sitting area with comfortable seating plus a conservatory. Free wi fi.

Reviews.Title: “great boutique experience in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Jaquins
Reviews.Content: The Praktik Rambla is small, friendly and well located. Minimalistic in decor, yet quite comfortable and adequate. Rooms slightly small by US standards, but fine and with excellent showers! Close to many great tapas restaurants, upscale shopping and architecturally significant buildings, including two of Gaudi's. Close enough to La Rambla, if one chooses to go that way. Easy Metro stop - use Passeig de Gracia stop from airport or airport bus to Placa de Catalunya. Very interesting use of historic building...web site photos are accurate.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Mmarymomm
Reviews.Content: Traveling with our adult daughter, we booked two rooms here for the price of one most other places. Although the rooms are small, they are perfectly adequate, clean and contemporary. Bathroom was very clean and had a shower, no tub. Our room which was on the street, was a little noisy at night. It seems that Barcelonans like to party late! Our daughter's room, not on the street, was very quiet. The metro is nearby and I recommend getting the Barcelona card. It is good for transportation and discounts. The breakfast at the restaurant next door was perfectly adequate and convenient. The people at the front desk were very nice and accommodating. English was spoken. We enjoyed our stay here very much.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mlucht
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an ideal location (and only two blocks from the stop for the very convenient and inexpensive airport shuttle and an easy walk from all sorts of fantastic modernist architecture as well as some of the best restaurants in the city), and occupies a lovely building with beautiful doors, accents, and an impressive open central shaft. The rooms are by no means opulent, but are designed with a very attractive contemporary style, have some character, and are fitted with sensible fixtures (the one downside was that ours was a little bit dark, since the windows were in the bathroom); the bathrooms are great. The staff, especially Olivia, is enormously helpful. For what you pay, an excellent value. The restaurant next door has very good updated tapas and is popular with tourists as well as locals. We would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable”
Reviews.Author: elpida20
Reviews.Content: Very nice and comfortable hotel at the most convenient location. Clean and quiet offered to me and my husband a memorable stay in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Large modern rooms with old city charm”
Reviews.Author: BKLYNTravels74
Reviews.Content: Hotel Praktik is conveniently located to the airport shuttle, metro, a short walk to Las Ramblas and the heart of the old city. I've never had such a large room in a European hotel. It was like having our own loft apartment. the hotel has basic ammenities but stay there for the location, great room, charming building and kind front desk staff. I would move in if I could!

Reviews.Title: “Would I recommend this hotel to a friend? – YES! Great value for money! Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Kisska27
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a short break in Barcelona for my husband’s birthday. I booked it via the hotels website with an additional 10% off if you pay in advance (£117 for 2 nights). Location is just superb- unbeatable! Rambla de Catalunya is the “posh” side of the Rambla’s. Only 10 min walk from Catalunya Metro, La Ramblas, Casa Battlo (opposite from Passeig de Gracia Metro & Train station - 20min to the airport ). We got a free upgrade to a room with a balcony (No: 302) on the 3rd floor. I’m very fussy when it comes to cleanliness and room décor, our room was very clean and tidy. Very modern and minimalist - just like in the photos. The bathroom was clean but it only had a big shower, no bath. Bathroom has no external windows and due to the poor air circulation has a bit of a funny damp smell in the morning (easily fixed with a bit of air-freshener). The bed was enormous and really comfortable. The weather was lovely, very warm in comparison with UK (15-17C and sunny). We had out air con at 26C while we were in and it didn’t feel cold at night or in the morning. At first I was worried that having a balcony would be very noisy (I’m a very light sleeper) but the windows/shutters were excellent at noise cancelling and I slept like a baby, despite our room facing a very busy street. We didn’t use the Lounge or the Patio Garden area but it looks lovely and I’m sure in the spring/summer time it’s a great place to have a drink and relax. The staff are lovely and smiley, make you feel very welcome. Would I recommend this hotel to a friend? – YES! Would I stay here again? – YES! Great value for money! Great Location! Pros: Location; Cleanliness; Good Value for Money; Friendly Staff; They don’t rush you at check out (you leave when you are ready). Cons: No tea or coffee making facilities; No Bathtub; Really small Reception area can get overcrowded at Check-in or Check-out.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: trvl09
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Hotel Parktik Rambla. We just returned from 5 nights there and would have only enjoyed our stay more had there not been other inconsiderate hotel guests running down the hall upstairs from us at 2 a.m. Of course, their behaviour is not a reflection of the hotel by any means. Cons: I will start with the one negative first as the positives by far outweigh the negatives. The room did not seem to be cleaned very well. Two things that were quite apparent was the half used bottle of body wash left from (I assume) the last guest in our shower which stayed there the whole time. Second, as our room was small, a bag got kicked under the bed and when we pulled it out it was covered in dust bunnies and lint. Pros: The hotel is in a great location – close enough to everything, Plaça Catalunya, La Rambla (but thankfully not on the actual Rambla), Casa Batlló, lovely restaurants, air port shuttle bus (cheaper than a taxi at 5.05 euros per person one way), etc. We did not have a room with a balcony so it was quite small but luckily we had small bags and the room was well laid out with shelves and hanging space so it was not a problem. The bathroom and the shower were lovely – with a rain shower head in the shower, H2O bath products and giant towels! The hotel itself is also quite lovely being in an old but well maintained building with plenty of space in the lift for two people with two bags. Above all the highlight of our stay was our interactions with two of the front desk staff, Maria and Petros (I hope I spelled that right). They always greeted us with a smile and helped us with any questions we had including restaurant recommendations, directions and Maria even managed to get us a last minute reservation for New Years Eve dinner. Thank you to both of you! We loved this hotel and will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Staff very helful and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Jen_Travel52
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect for restaurants and sight seeing. A short walk to the Metro. Special buses to and from the airport leave from Catalunya Square which is just a 3 or 4 minute walk. Also only a 5 minute walk to the "La Rambla" . The staff speak English and are very helpful. They had a great Garden and sitting area for their guests. Internet was free and they had a computer available. The only downside was that there were no "tea and coffee" facilities or fridge in the room. No restaurant at the hotel but they have vouchers you can purchase for breakfast next door.

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Craine5
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because of the hotel location as it was our first trip to Barcelona. The staff in reception were very helpful and polite, and spoke excellent English. Our room was very modern and clean. Only complaint was that the bathroom was freezing! There's a restaurant next door for breakfast and so many places to eat dinner that we were spoilt for choice. Would certainly recommend the bus tours on your first day as you get a better feel for the city. I loved Barcelona and would definitely stay at this hotel again - probably in the early summer so we could enjoy the lovely rooftop terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location- cold in the winter”
Reviews.Author: BCNRocks
Reviews.Content: Although the weather in Barcelona was great for December- 14C with sun, it was cold in the hotelroom. It is an old building with high ceiling, pretty rooms, modern decoration. There was airconditioner which we used for pumping warm air into the room. Bathroom+toilet did not have this possibility, plus there was a window outside. It was freeeeeezing in the bathroom. Taking a shower or sitting on the toilet was a cold shock wave. The floor is cold stone, typical for Barcelona's old buildings, and it was extremely dirty. I suppose the floor was washed once in a while, but my feet and socks were black from walking around the room. The walls are thin and doors are not sound isolated, I could hear people talking and laughing, even sneezing in the room next to us. GREAT, PERFECT BED! LOCATION, you cannot beat it!!!! 5 minut walk to Plaza Catalunya. I love Rambla de Catalunya, it is quite and has great shops and restaurants. The staff was helpful. The room was big.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Stevesh69
Reviews.Content: Just returned home after a short stay at the hotel. I had made the choice in part based on the reviews here so it's only fair to add something. Had a lovely room with a fantastic views up Rambla de Catalunya just made it that little bit more special. This is a great hotel in an excellent location in the heart of the city with friendly and helpful staff. If you are looking for somewhere to stay I'd recommend looking at this.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a beautiful city.”
Reviews.Author: Kabrady
Reviews.Content: Myself and my 3 children aged 23,21 and 16 stayed in 2 rooms in late November, early December. Rooms were extremely well appointed and wifi in the rooms was a huge asset. Staff helpful and location of hotel perfect for first time trip to Barcelona. Would dearly love to come back to this hotel and city.

Reviews.Title: “One night only, but will be back”
Reviews.Author: Rob T
Reviews.Content: We arrived very late from London, our taxi driver had difficulty finding Hotel Praktik Rambla. I would put this down to our Australian accent in giving the location than the poor driver not knowing where to go. Once we arrived near midnight, we instantly loved the location and the hotel. The recepetion staff were wondrful and directed us to what we could only say, a suprise room. Looking from the outside, you see what we would call the historic spanish influence, the same when walking in the foyer, but when we got to the room, there was this large fresh contemporary room, we loved it. The staff and accommodation, and of course Barcelona made it a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “I loved our stay at the Praktik Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Anita19111493
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located, close to major attractions and transit, it is also attractive, eclectic, clean, recently remodeled and has friendly staff. Not for honeymooners, but Ok for couples or smaller groups that want to stay in cozy hotel. If you are looking for a good night sleep, a good full size shower, clean facilities, excellent service and a good location for a great price this is your place. We have recommended the hotel to friends and will stay there again in our next visit to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Location but poor Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: Vishnu_Malli
Reviews.Content: Hotel :- Old Catalonian building converted into a very Stylish & a Chic Hotel. It says it all. A stylist backyard is a nice to sit around and chill out. Location:- Heart of the action. Walkable to Rue Rambla. You don't wanna stay on Rue Rambla as it is very touristy. This hotel is located on Rambla de Catalunya, which is really beautiful street. Great cafes and restaurants on this street. A 5-7 min walk to the Metro. Rooms:- Wow. Aesthetically designed. High ceilings. Very comfortable bed. Great bathrooms with a rain shower. I loved the bottle green tiles in the bath. Service:- The guys at the front desk were sloppy. 1.While checking in. The receptionist asked me for my card. I assumed it was for a credit card guarantee. He swipes it for the full amount even without confirming with me. I found that vague. I actually wanted pay by cash. 2.They recommend a restaurant which was closed for the season ( they should have at least called and made sure it was open). We walked all the way to find it shut. 3. When I asked them info on some sights in BCN, they told me to walk down the road and find a tourist information desk. LOL. This hotel definitely needs a concierge. 4. On the first night when I wanted a quick info on the metro, the guy at the reception was engaged on a long telephonic conversation. I initially thought that he was attending to a query/guest. Then I realized that he was generally chit chatting and laughing around. Finally, after 10-12 mins, he acknowledges me. And unfortunately... All I wanted to know is... what time the metro shuts? :) Verdict: If you can live with mediocre service, you will find this hotel great in every other aspect. Free internet is always appreciated :)

Reviews.Title: “Modern boutique hotel in heart of city”
Reviews.Author: Sundance1
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our stay here. Wish it could have been longer. Clean, modern rooms. Loved the bathrooms. The front desk staff girl was very helpful. Spoke excellent English. The tapas restaurant across (kitty corner) was great. Loved roaming the city Rambla area on foot. I agree with the review that said to skip the breakfast next door. the waitress was rude and food less than average. Go out and find a croissant at a cafe. Not worth the $. Loved Barcelona and the Hotel Praktik, will be back.

Reviews.Title: “A true gem”
Reviews.Author: highdesertwanderer
Reviews.Content: I have had the pleasure of staying here three times. It is located near La Rambla and hidden among a lot of shops and tapas bars. The staff is amazing and they switch between Spanish, French, Italian and English seamlessly. If you want the flavor of Barcelona, select a room with a street view. If you want a quieter experience, select a room on the back side. Barcelona stays up late so finding breakfast early can be challenging. A great place for breakfast is “31 Rambla” located nearby. The taxi stand is across the street and the tourist busses stage from the main square a few blocks a way. La Rambla is meant to be experienced on foot, so bring comfortable walking shoes and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location along the lines of a boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: sherman3110
Reviews.Content: The Praktik Rambla Hotel is located in a smart street to the north of the Ramblas with some very good restaurants on the doorstep (particularly Taller de Tapas at No 49-50). Internally the Hotel is modern and stylish with an impressive vast central stairwell housing the lift shaft. The decor of the large room which we had was very contemporary in black and white, the room having a very high ornate ceiling and opening onto what was once a balcony now housing the walk in wet room space and washing/wc area - all beautifully equipt. The room is minimally fitted and would benefit from some additional furniture. Being a party of three we had to use the sofa as a bed which meant there was no additional seating area other than on the bed. The lighting was too 'low energy' which made life difficult at times. Sadly we experienced a handbag robbery and in addition one of us was ill. The Front Desk responded extremely well giving us all the advice and help we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: SandyOma
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is truly a gem. The staff is very helpful and friendly and the rooms are super clean and comfortable. And location!!! Perfect--a couple of blocks from Plaza Catalunya and the head of La Rambla. Great for all the walking Barcelona demands. We upgraded to the Wow feature and got a 2nd floor room on the street side with a balcony built for 2. There are restaurants on the street below which are great for people watching but can be noisy at night; however, there is a series of great doors that shut out a good deal of the noise and ALL the light. Take ear plugs if you're a light sleeper and choose this option. My husband is a sound sleeper and he slept through everything--including the early morning recycling trucks. I thought our room was quite large by European standards. Shampoo, body wash and hair dryer are supplied There is a computer on the 1st floor that we used for checking e-mail, restaurants, flight status, etc. Very convenient. We just really loved our time here. We took the bus from the airport (A1 bus) and it dropped us at Plaza Catalunya. We also took the bus back to the airport and it's super easy. 5.05 euros each, 1/2 hour trip. No confusion or worries, and the buses run every few minutes. Additionally, don't miss Ciutat Condal on the corner for tapas. Qu Qu is also good (the hotel gives you a discount card for a few restaurants), although Tapa Tapa was a disappointment. And have morning cafe at Cafe Zurich at the head of La Rambla. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “A gem right in the heart of Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: andrew2248
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated right in the heart of tourist Barcelona, a very short walking distance from Placa Catalunya and the Ramblas as well as many good restaurants. Amenities in the hotel are limited but ideal for those that want to spend their time out and about. Service was first class and all the staff very helpful and friendly. Rooms are generally a little on the small side but we paid extra and had a larger double room. No mini-bar in the room so it would have been nice to have an ice-machine somewhere in the hotel. Free Wi-Fi was useful. Overall we were very impressed and will certainly return when next in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: rsbutton
Reviews.Content: I liked the location of this hotel, the deck out back for sitting & relaxing, nice staff. Rooms are quite small but well-arranged; didn't spend much time in them anyway.

Reviews.Title: “loved the praktik”
Reviews.Author: charley48
Reviews.Content: thanks to all the great staff, olivia especially (who helped me thru the computer, and really went out of her way for us), for making our time in barcelona the best. the building is a wonder, carvings, wrough iron, chic as can be. even the lighting on the doors is wonderful. the rooms are very modern, with lovely walk in showers of green tile. the rooms are outfitted beautifully, and with a quiet room at the back, we just had the best time. thanks so much.

Reviews.Title: “Just the type of hotel we were looking for...historic, charming, compact with an incredible staff.”
Reviews.Author: jabMpls_MN
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a wonderful surprise to us. A beautiful historic hotel which 110 years ago was a family reidence. The staff was extremely helpful in every way, from suggesting sights, restaurants, transportation, etc. Our room was small, but well appointed. A king size comfortable bed afforded us a good nights sleep as we set out each morning for the most beautiful sights of Barcelona. Such an incredbily beautiful city which we hope to return to again some day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! However, bathroom smelled.”
Reviews.Author: Drewseph
Reviews.Content: We loved the boutique style of this hotel (even the elevator was cool) and the location is perfect. However, our bathroom smelled like chemicals, which made the entire room smell. We left the bathroom fan on and opened the windows, but the smell didn't go away. The front desk said housekeeping probably used chemicals to prevent the drains from clogging. He called housekeeping and informed them of the smell. So they cleaned our room again, but on day two the smell was still there. We just kept the bathroom door closed and dealt with it. In hindsight, we should have asked for another room as soon we walked into the room. There are plenty of restaurants around the hotel. I would skip the ones right next to the hotel and go across the street to Ciudad Condal. The food was excellent! It is very popular, so go early.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Ardner
Reviews.Content: We booked on-line months in advance & asked for a quiet room. Such requests are frequently ignored but not here. We were given Room 208 in the back of the hotel at the end of the hall. The only noise problem came from the door locks/doors, which have to be pulled hard when entering or leaving the room This creates a real slam effect. Great staff, well laid out rooms with nice beds & great shower and bathroom. Wonderful tapas restaurant (Cuidad Condal) right up the street. A great location for walks up the Rambla de Catalunya and the Passeig de Gracia. Avoid the famous Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel in a Wonderful City”
Reviews.Author: Oldebuffalo
Reviews.Content: Hotel Praktik Rambla is an experience not to be missed! The location is perfect, the structure is Barcelona through and through, the staff - absolutely wonderful, and the room was very comfortable. We throughly enjoyed our three day stay and would go back in a minute. We'd have rated this hotel 5 stars if the lift hadn't cratered, which required a good deal of stair climbing. 5 stars to the staff for assisting with our luggage and transportation requirements!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, A bit pricey, weird rooms, restaurants either side work well”
Reviews.Author: marknadel
Reviews.Content: The hotel was hard to find, because it is only one door wide at the front, and has no parking. The location is really good because it is on the nicer side of Catalunya Plaza and has decent restaurants all around it without the crass noisy yobby feel of the other side of the Plaza. Found the room a bit dark, but most European hotels are the same. Bed was comfortable and bathroom was reasonable. Very quiet at night. 7 Euros gets you breakfast in the restaurant at the base of the hotel, owned by the same people. Breakfast was a bit too oily and undercooked so we started eating elsewhere. Ate in both the restaurants either side of the hotel and they were both good. Also liked Sinatra's about 2 miles down towards the Gothic Area. Thai Garden restaurant is about 1 block from here if you like Thai food. Safe in room worked okay. Wifi was free and worked well. Complaints: No English TV other than CNBC Money program and CNN - despite the fact we kept meeting English speaking guests. Our room (207) was really only a giant bed. They have a huge unit across the end of the bed (see photos) to form a giant cot. This unit takes up most of the floor space and blocks the room. It is a weird design. The unit forms the end of the bed and the TV is fixed on the back of this unit facing the bed. If you want to watch TV you have to be on the bed. In fact there really was nothing we could do in the room other than sit on the bed because there is only this giant unit and the bed in the room. There was about 2ft/30cm down either side of the bed to get in and out - the space is useless for anything else. The lights over the bed stick out on stalks and my wife cut her nose on it in the dark returning to bed, we found that we could push them to one side but it was very hard. No bed side tables but there is a ledge down the back. No clock. No chairs. No desk - nothing in room but the end of bed unit. Storage space is below average - but there are some shelves and a small hanging area. No fridge or any kettle/tea or coffee making equipment . But the location is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel that we love to revisit”
Reviews.Author: BarcelonaOct2010
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a splendid old building that was redesigned in a modern style that gives the place a real charm. The roolms are well accessorized and comfortable for a couple. The service was just fantastic and staff was attentive and responsive to any request we might had. The location just 2 blocks from Catalonia squre is great as well. In summary, we coiuldn't have selected better. Pnina & Gal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Gry17
Reviews.Content: This hotel has great location, and still there was no noice Great service. The rooms have a nice style, combination of old and new. Double rooms vere a bit small, but more than good enough. The triple rooms had a bad extra bed, it was a couch.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Boutique Hotel in the Center of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: biztrav123
Reviews.Content: A 27euro taxi ride from Barcelona's fantastic airport will find you on the door step of Praktik Rambla, right on the north end of the Rambla de Catalunya, a few blocks from the old city. Walk through the entrance, through a stone "tunnel" into the center of this (6 story? can't remember exactly) townhouse and you find yourself in an open atrium that reaches up to the glass roof at the top of the building. A small reception desk, a central elevator, and a central staircase are on the ground floor. the effect is pretty cool You will be warmly greeted by Estaban or his associate who were both very helpful and courteous. On the first floor is a computer workstation with internet connection, but there is free wifi available as well. A wide open, sunny library with plenty of comfortable seating and a large table/workspace are also available. Outside the library is a sunny terrace with plenty of seating, chaise lounges, and tables/chairs for relaxing or getting some work done. The hotel is very simple, but very elegant. In a way it is really "no frills", but the design is really lovely. I had a single room as I was there on business. I won't lie...the room was tiny. The closet was not deep enough to hold a jacket on a hanger perpendicular to the pole..everything had to be on an angle.
