Not much room for storage, my garment bag went under the closet and I had to slip my suitcase under the bed. Now I knew why there was so much communal room to lounge in, lol....but, its better that way, why do you want to sit in your room? Again, room was very small, but very nicely done. Long narrow room with bed at one end, bathroom facilities at the other...simple stark white walls, white/black headboard and storage area, white linens. Tile floors. One glassed in cubicle for the toilette and sink. Another glass cubicle open to the room with shower. Shower had one of those great big overhead shower heads (nice) as well a hand shower. Bathroom area was done in a neat green glassy tile on the walls. Spotlessly clean. Did not get a chance to peek in at a double room or any higher rate rooms. Hotel is in a great location, with restaurants and shopping all around. The best place in Barcelona for tapas, Ciudad Condal, is on the corner across the street from the hotel. Little place next door is where you can get breakfast in the morning. Some rates have it included with the room, others don't. You get a voucher from the front desk. Honestly, i think it was a touch cheaper just do get coffee, a pastry, and maybe a little ham on a baguette on your own. Walk around the corner for a convenient subway stop. Walk a few blocks to reach the old town. Would absolutely go back to this hotel, particularly if on vacation. The negatives: 1) The high ceilings, central atrium, bare walls, and solid floors means sound carries. The doors are a bit heavy and everyone on my floor seemed not to get the concept of not letting them slam. It wasn't crazy as the hotel is generally quiet as people spend their day and evenings out on the streets, so I guess a minor negative...I just got startled a few times when trying to doze off, lol. 2) Tiny room means a tiny bathroom. I can picture someone with a complicated morning routine crying in frustration. I know my GF would have gone nuts trying to get ready in there in the am. No counter space...there are no counters. Small sink is wedged in the corner up against the wall and I couldn't even stand over it to brush my teeth 3) If you are there on business, don't expect to get any work done in your room. There are no work surfaces. This was a drawback for me. I was there over the weekend, so I took time for sightseeing, but I had to get work done, too. So, you had to go out to the library to do it....some of my work is sensitive and I don't like being out like that. Again, i had a small single room, so I can't say that its that way in the doubles, but I get the feeling it is as I hear someone from a double complaining that there were no chairs in the room. Its not a business hotel, its a vacation spot. the only other negative I can say is not a negative about the hotel itself, but about Barcelona in general. WATCH YOUR BELONGINGS LIKE A HAWK...the city is full of pickpockets and thieves. I know too many people that have lost stuff on the streets. A couple had their backpack stolen righ in the lobby of the hotel while I was checking in. Let me stress that this is not the fault of the hotel or staff...just a fact. I was targeted by a woman who saw me fumbling with my bags getting out of a taxi (I was on a 2 week trip and had a garment bag, small roller, and computer bag)...she followed me in pretending to read a tourist map, hoping that I would get distracted and she could steal my computer bag. By training, i dumped all my stuff in front of me agains the reception desk. When she saw she couldn't get my stuff, she sidled over to a lone bag that the other couple had left unattended by the door, picked it up and casually walked out the door, all the time reading her map. None of us realized what had happened for another minute or so, when the couple realized that their bag was gone. The receptionist was occupied speaking to the couple and his view of their bag was obstructed by his computer monitor. He was absolutely mortified that it happened and ran out the door trying to find the woman. No luck. Keys, camera, phone, computer gone, just like that.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and design. LOVED the bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: HolboxBound
Reviews.Content: My friend and I needed a hotel for 1 night in Barcelona after some flight cancellations before heading out to the Costa Brava. My family happened to be staying at the Praktik Rambla for a couple of days before their cruise so we decided to join them for one night. We got a great last minute rate of 80 euros/night! which was awesome considering the quality of the place. I normally prefer to stay at more intimate, rustic, 2 star places since I generally travel on a budget, and would probably never have considered the Praktik Rambla (or even the neighborhood, L'Eixample). But it was certainly nice to pamper ourselves for a night! beautifully designed, minimalist but elegant rooms, gorgeous all-over green tile in the bathroom, RAINSHOWER, beautiful tilework on the floors, large balcony overlooking the Rambla Catalunya. Noisy, yes, but not a problem for us. food options in the area weren't as good as in El Born (where we stayed the first 3 nights in Barcelona) and was pricey, which was a downside. Definitely more upscale, older clientele as well (compared to the Born), but I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again for the atmosphere of the hotel itself! wonderful outdoor patio as well, with showers, but no pool? kinda odd...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Gothic Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OliAtkinson
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I recently had a very enjoyable stay at Hotel Praktik Rambla. We had hoped that the hotel would provide a relaxing, well-located base for a short city-break and were certainly not disappointed. The hotel is in a great, central spot - on the Ramblas, but north of the Plaza Catalunya, so it's not too hectic or noisy nearby. We upgraded to a Praktik WOW! room, which meant we had a good-sized room overlooking the relaxing sun-terrace. The room itself was beautiful, with high ceilings and big windows. The walk in shower was another good feature. The best feature of the hotel was the relaxing sun terrace. It was a lovely place to spend the morning, soaking up the sun, enjoying a coffee and listening to the relaxing background music. There a plenty of nearby restaurants and cafes - Ciudad Condal was well worth the wait in the evening. I'd have no hesitation in recommending this hotel- and will no doubt stay again the next time I'm in Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Great Room and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Ehaslam
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I stayed in a triple one night prior to our cruise. We were traveling with 6 other family members. We booked this hotel because of its reasonable price, location and good reviews we'd read. The location was perfect being close to P. Cataluyna and Las Ramblas. No food here but we didn't expect it. The terrace was a great place for us all to meet. The building has been tastefully updated and is very unique and fun. I thought our room was quite spacious and modern. The bathroom was beautiful with green tile and a large, modern shower but it was open to the bedroom area unless you shut the huge pocket door which couldn't be opened from the inside once closed. Thankfully, my son and husband let me out when I was done showering! They also had internet available on a computer in a shared area which was handy.. The staff really stood out for us. We had flight trouble, arrived 6 hours late at about 6:oo pm and didn't get 2 of our 3 bags (the one we did get was broken and wrapped in plastic). They suggested where we could look for a replacement bag, took our lost luggage information and followed up with the airline and delivery service regularly. This was a huge relief as we'd been traveling for over 24 hours. We went and bought a new bag, had dinner and hit the sack. We still didn't have all our bags when we checked out the next day so left what we had with the hotel and went to see Barcelona. When we returned about 4:00, we were happy to find that the rest of our luggage had been delivered so we proceeded to the ship for the rest of our trip! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for handicap travelers”
Reviews.Author: lmc1970
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel based on reviews and quick response from the hotel regarding accomadations for handicap travelers. We are a family of 7, booked two rooms prior to our 10 day Disney Cruise. Entrance: Very charming and has a ramp, so not a problem at all for wheelchairs. Location: Close to Plaza Catalunya (5-10min walk), but not in busy, nosiy area like off La Rambla. Many great restaurants right out the door, don't miss Ciudad Capital for excellent tapas. Rooms: My husband and two small children (age 1 and 4) fit comfortably in a standard room with a king size bed and small couch. Room was small, but clean and bed was comfortable. The rain shower is amazing, they provide hair dryers in every bathroom. We also had wonderful view from our balcony. Airconditioners worked fine in every room. My parents and younger sister stayed in a handicap room which was HUGE (even for american standards)! There was a roll-in shower and the toilet was an appropriate height for my father's rolling shower/toilet chair, the large bathroom was very easy to maneuver around. In addition,they provided an extra full size bed for my sister. No problems at all for my father who is completely wheelchair bound, plenty of space...probably triple the size of a standard room. The Lift is small, but still not a problem for my father. Decor: Primarily black and white, modern and elegantly simple. Cons: the hotel lobby is tiny, but that can be a good thing...no lines. There is no bell hop (but the staff were very helpful in assisting us with our bags...tons with small kids and one handicap traveller), and no ice machine, which is sometimes useful in hot weather. Overall Impression: beautiful boutique hotel with a lot of charm. Would definitely stay again when back in Barcelona and highly recommend this hotel for travellers in a wheelchair (especially room 409).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Needs11
Reviews.Content: I knew that I was coming Barcelona but I hadn't booked a hotel yet there. My booking at Praktik Hotel was last minute and I ended up getting an amazing deal also. The room is very clean and the bathroom is amazing, it felt like you are in a spa. The hotel it self is beautiful. The room I was in was small but if you are there for vacation you shouldn't be in your room. The bed is comfortable! The staff is very helpful and the location is great. When I go back to Barcelona, I will be staying at this hotel again. I was there for four days and if you are going to go around Barcelona, I highly recommend the Barcelona Card which allows you to ride the local transportation for free and gives you discounts and free entrances to many museums and attractions in Barcelona. Also the hotel is 15-20 min. from the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: pdlee
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay at the Praktik Rambla and I would rate the hotel highly overall. Although very small, the rooms were very nicely decorated, were well equiped and the beds were extremely comfortable. Staff were helpful and facilities were good which included free wi-fi. The only negative was the incredibly poor breakfast offered by the hotel at the Piscolabas restaurant next door which was an absolute rip off. We paid at the time of booking for breakfast and received a voucher which entitled us to either an "English Breakfast" (2 small rashers of bacon, one fried egg, one small juice and one small tea or coffee), a "Continental Breakfast" (one croissant, one tiny sausage roll, one small juice and one small tea or coffee) or a "Healthy Breakfast" (a small bowl of muesli, chesse and ham sandwich, one small juice and one small tea or coffee. Avoid this as there are plenty of better places to get breakfast in Barcelona. Otherwise excellent and would certainly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Bday WE in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Giovy1980
Reviews.Content: Very good address with polite and helpful staff, great location (very central), nice lobby & terrace at the 1st floor, no noise if your room is on the courtyard side. Even if the rooms (at least our) are little, they are really cute and provide all the necessary: AC, free Wi-FI, flat-screen TV, real hairdryer, great shower... If I come back to Barcelona (I will for sure) I'll turn back to Praktik Rambla without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Good location... terrible services and amenities”
Reviews.Author: tareq74
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very good location that is quite close to La Rambla and Plaza de Catatunya where most of the sightseeing tours start. However, the hotel lacks the following which I believe that are basics in most of the hotels regardless of the star rating: 1. No mini bar 2. No restaurant or food service in the rooms in the hotel 3. All the TV and Radio channels are Spanish or Catalan. No single English channel is available 4. No iron board or iron machine available. 5. No tissue boxes. The receptionist told us to use toilet paper for our face. 6. No shower cap 7. No hair conditioner 8. The service in general is terrible: It took us more than 3 hours to check-in. 9. In the hotel restaurant next door "PISCOLABIS": The service is very very very bad and the food quantity is so small and poor. 10. The air condition in the room is split unit that stops all of a sudden in the middle of the night. 11. The wireless internet is terrible. It always disconnects after couple of minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Functional hotel with ideal location”
Reviews.Author: aliasmalu
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right on La Rambla in a section called Rambla de Catalunya. It will cost you about 25 euros to get to the hotel from the airport in a cab. There is a bus station and metro station a couple of blocks from the hotel at Placa de catalunya if you want to save some money and dont mind the adventure. The room is rather small. As soon as you open the door you have to side step to get in b/c the edge of the bed is there. However, we did receive housekeeping every day and the room was clean and well kept. And as we spent little time in the room except to sleep and shower, I think it was adequate for our needs. I thought it was strange that they did not have an iron and when I inquired about it they told me it was a security risk. Wifi is provided free of charge in your room if you have a laptop but you need an adapter if you are coming from the US. The adapter we had didnt work to charge our computer but we were able to log onto the internet on the 1st floor free of charge. There is one elevator but 2 people can easily fit with their luggage. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel so I cannot speak to that. Breakfast doesnt seem to be a big deal in Barcelona but if you want something hot u can go next door to Piso labis I think its called (red awnings on the tables) and they make fried eggs and toast or Happy Bar and Grill a couple blocks away has a simple hot breakfast. You also get a 10% discount at some of the surrounding tapas restaurants. When they give you the room keys its held in a card that states on there which ones. Try Sangria de Cava if the restaurants have it. very refreshing. We went to Pla which was a very good restaurant Con Gracia which was also good but a little pricey We did a lot of walking and skipped the transportation pass b/c we wanted a different experience. The hotel really seemed to push getting a taxi to go to restaurants but we enjoyed the walk and mostly places were only 20 mins away. We used our maps and they will make reservations for you. If you ask how to get there they printed out a google map that showed which way to go and they will explain it. Just ask for the map to be printed out

Reviews.Title: “perfect location,friendly staff, value for money,beautiful building”
Reviews.Author: helenMullingar
Reviews.Content: i recently had the pleasure of staying in your beautiful hotel.i was travelling with my cousin and uncle.we loved the spacious double room with its classy decor and most amazing shower.it was my first trip to barcelona and your hotel and staff helped to make it an unforgettable experience.we found your receptionist RUEBEN to be most helpful with all our queries. he directed us to a fabulous tapas restaurant across the road on our frst night and we ate there every night afterwards,it was soo good.your hotel is the prefect location to enjoy the city due to its central location within walking distance of las ramblas and a host of restaurants.will definately be recommending it to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “funky and convenient”
Reviews.Author: mileslockwood
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated and is beautifully decorated. The rooms have cool bathrooms and lovely walk in showers... luxury! The terrace is very cool and good if you want to chill out with a beer in the early evening. The only negatives would be the beds which are adequate but perhaps a little basic in terms of comfort. The breakfast that you have in the adjoining bar via a voucher I thought was really quite poor and if I visit again I would not bother to pay for this again. That said if as and when I come back to Barcelona I will definitely be staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for art lovers”
Reviews.Author: Cityboy4
Reviews.Content: If you're coming to Barcelona to spend a few days checking out the works of Gaudi then you'll really appreciate this hotel. It's an amazing 19th century listed property which has been respectfully modernised on a quiet street near the city centre. Our room was very stylish with gorgeous bathroom and always clean. There's a really nice terrace garden where you can relax with an ice cream from one of the nearby shops. Wi-fi at no extra cost, a small library with PC if you need access but don't have a laptop. There's no need to tie yourself down to hotel cuisine as you're surrounded by restaurants serving tapas. Hotel staff were very friendly and always helpful. Highly recommended for art enthusiasts looking to check out the city, not the perfect choice if you're wanting waiter service by a pool.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: terryg500
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well placed within a few minutes walk of Placa Cataluna and the Ramblas. The room, whilst the decoration was too dark for my taste, was fine and the power shower invigorating. One of the best features is the outside lounge area which we used in the evening but could have been used for sun barthing during the day. Wifi available. The staff were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,”
Reviews.Author: pandaSydney
Reviews.Content: My first time in Barcelona, and this hotel was perfect! Great location on the ramblas, but a block or two up from Plaza de catalunya in a classier part that was a bit quieter. Easy walk to the hotel from the airport bus, close to conveniant metro station, surrounded by some great restaurants, easy walk to the main section of the ramblas and everything that surrounds it. Staff were friendly and helpful. Room was very cool, with a huge bed, funky decorations and a great bathroom. We had a small balcony that looked over the ramblas - it was too small to actually sit out there, but it was nice at times to be able to open the doors and just look and listen to Barcelona. The terrace is a great spot to spend some time relaxing when your body is tired of sightseeing - some great couches and an outdoor shower to cool off ... we even had a siesta out there one afternoon. If you were staying in Barcelona with friends it would be a perfect spot to have a couple of bottles of wine and some nibbles from the market.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Guldeniz
Reviews.Content: I have spent 5 nights at Hotel Praktic Rambla with my husband and 7 yeras old son this summer. It was really a pleasure for all of us. The hotel stuff was very kind, helpfull and polite. They were always ready to answer all kind of questions with enthusiasm. The location of the hotel is an other advantage which is very close to old city and most of the Gaudi architecture. I have to confess that the size of the room was bigger than I expected with a double bed and a single bed for our son withuot fee. During reservation process we requested a room with a balcony which was ready on our arrival. The terrace of the hotel is an other place where you could drink or eat something that you brought form outside. The bathroom was comfortable with a shining shower and brilliant shampoos and shower gels. I strongly recommend the tapas of the nearby restaurant piscolabis and the other restaurant with the name begining cituitat and I do not remember the other word. The whole Barcelona journay of my family was perfect except one thing that I feel myself to warn eveybody to avoid the nearby restaurant " HAPPY MEAL" where we have spent lots of money for nothing. There is nothing delicious there and we left our table nearly starving. I am looking forward to staying in HOTEL PRAKTİC RAMBLA again. Thank you for everything. The hotel worth more than its price.

Reviews.Title: “highly advisable”
Reviews.Author: torino2010
Reviews.Content: beautiful and elegant, in the centre of the city not expensive with respect to the location

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Volodymyr60
Reviews.Content: I've chosen this hotel because of its vicinity to Paceig de Gracia train station - walking distance. It is also very well located to reach La Rambla as well as to have a look at some of Gaudi buildings. Stay in this hotel is also an opportunity to have a look at the (probably) typical building in this area of Barcelona. Very friendly and efficient staff. Room is very large with perfect facilities. There is very nice terrace. Nice breakfast at the cafe next door. A lot of reastaurants around in some of which you can get a discount with the hotel card.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, nice & helpful staff, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Mary_3012
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Praktik Rambla and would recommend it any time. When booking the hotel we were concerned about the hotel being on the noisy and busy Rambla and were pleasantly surprised by the nice and quiet location when we arrived. The staff was always friendly and really took the time to advise us on things to do (and to watch out for) in Barcelona. The rooms were nicely designed and basic in that you had everything you needed including one of the best showers ever. The only point, in our view, which distinguishes this hotel from an "excellent" rated one, is that the room service staff kept slamming the doors which was rather annoying particularly in the morning. All in all a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Cental and Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GPoon
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 7 nights in around mid Aug 2010. The room arranged for us is very nice, with a private balcony. The room is quiet. The shower is very good. The staff are very nice. The hotel provides free wifi. The hotel is near catalunya plaza. It is also near Pg de Gracia and Catalunya meter stations. Around the hotel, there are a lot of restaurants. There is also a bakery across the road (31 rambla catalunya) where you can enjoy a simply and delicous breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Couples - Simple, clean, great location”
Reviews.Author: uniboy02
Reviews.Content: Great for couples, we were on part two of our honeymoon. Excellent service with very helpful and friendly staff. Rooms a little small - which is standard for European major cities - but well equipped throughout. The atrium and central apex is wonderful and something to behold. Overall: lovely stay, terrific value, great location with bars literally outside/next door. Perfect base for hassle-free romance and absorbing the vibrant atmosphere of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Perfecto!”
Reviews.Author: jetsetter0809
Reviews.Content: There is good reason that this Hotel is rated #12 out of 561 hotels in Barcelona on Trip Advisor. My husband and I stayed at Hotel Praktik Rambla for 2 nights for our one-year anniversary. He had done a lot of research, trying to find the perfect place to stay, and we could not have been more thrilled with our choice of Hotel Praktik Rambla. We have been lucky enough to travel with both high end and budget accommodations. From Santorini to Prague to Rio, we've seen a lot of nice hotels, but this one really stood out. Location: Superb! The hotel is located just off the main drag of La Rambla enough to escape the madness but still so close you can feel the action. There is a metro stop just a short 2-3 minute walk away that will take you to the beach or any other destination easily. The street outside is a bit more classy than La Rambla and is full of many different types of restaurants and other hotels. Below our balcony, the center walkway between the smaller streets was sprinkled with cute, outdoor seating for nearby restaurants. It was a quiet area but you can also open the balcony door and hear the enchanting sounds of the city, including the faint sound of clinking glassware and hushed chatter, if you so wish. Aesthetic: Trendy, cozy, modern yet classic. We loved the décor in our room and around the hotel. Our room was black and white with bold furniture pieces with unique shapes, a plush king size bed, couch for lounging and flat screen television. The bathroom is dark green tile, enclosed by walls that are all mirror on the outside. Its makes the room feel much larger and creates an effect that can be quite fun. The bathroom showerheads are also worth mentioning. It is directly overhead and wonderful! There is also an additional, removable showerhead as well. The common area of the hotel includes a large study with masculine table and a large patio on the second level with swanky furniture. From the patio, you can see the tops of buildings that surround the area and highlight the beautiful architecture of Barcelona. Furthermore, there is an internet spot which provides free internet access on the hotel's computer. Staff: The staff was very helpful and eager to answer all of our questions. We were even surprised upon our arrival to learn that they had upgraded us from a standard room to a superior room that faced the main street below. Remarks: For its price, this hotel exceeded all our expectations. To be in a the heart of the action but yet still away from it all is the perfect balance. If you can, request one of the rooms with a balcony over looking the entrance on Praktik Catalunya as this is what offers a great look at the atmosphere in this area of the city. Overall, Hotel Praktik Rambla is a steal and was perfect for our anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the very heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: TatevikD
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have spent one week at Praktik Rambla for our honeymoon! The location of the hotel is just perfect, right in the heart of city, from which we could easily reach all the attractions either by foot or by metro. Hotel staff was perfect as well, always very nice and ready to help! The room we had on the forth floor with a balcony on Plaza Catalunya was nice and cozy, however if you prefer rooms with a lot of space for two people, double rooms of this hotel may be a bit too small for you! The location of the hotel was also ideal for accessing restaurants and cafes, there were a lot of them all around the hotel. We have tried on our first morning the breakfast offered at the restaurant near by the hotel paying 15.50 euros for two of us. However, the menu was nothing special and we have quickly realized that for less amount we can get better breakfast in a lot other nearby cafes. Also the hotel is ideally located for all those who love to shop & shop & shop, just a few steps away from Passeig de Gracia with all the shops! For the money we have paid we were really satisfied with our stay and would defiantly recomend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location,helpful staff and a comfy bed!”
Reviews.Author: sagepompey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a week whilst attending the European Athletics Competition. it was perfectly located on a bus route that took us to the stadium and close to two metro stations. We breakfasted every day in the restaurant opposite which was fine and their snacks were good too.The staff were very helpful and the room was very clean.We loved the big walk in shower with two heads and the kingsize bed. The terrace was nice to sit out in the fresh air and we appreciated the use of the free computer. The left luggage facility was cheap and useful as were the drinks machines on the ground floor. There was a little noise on the Friday and Saturday evenings so I would probably ask for a room at the back if I go again. There are loads of good restaurants nearby and the lunchtime menus are very good value for money.We especially enjoyed Mussol on the Carrer casp and the Patagonia on the Gran via which was very smart yet we enjoyed a three course meal with wine water and coffee for £50 for both of us.

Reviews.Title: “great location, fun hotel”
Reviews.Author: hpatkinson
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights at the end of our honeymoon, and it was nice to finally stay in a hotel with a big room. The hotel is an old historic building, but very modern decor with bold coloring. The balcony was nice, but not necessary as there was no seating area so don't pay for it. The bed was a real king, not 2 twins pushed together. The staff was friendly and helpful. The only downside was there was no refrigerator in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: travelingtexan1
Reviews.Content: Five of us shared two rooms in mid July 2010. We stayed two nights prior to embarking on our cruise. We arrived early the first morning and the staff told us one room would be ready in 15 minutes and the other would be ready in an hour. They graciously held our luggage, even though they don't have much space. We roamed around the tree-lined streets for a bit and found some great places to eat. When we returned, our rooms were ready. Check-in was a breeze. We had rooms on the fifth floor (Level 4). They were adjacent and both faced the rear of the building. There isn't much to look at outside but the floor-to-ceiling windows in the bathroom were still dramatic. The walk-in rain showers were excellent! The beds were comfortable with the exception of my sister's roll-away. The size of the rooms were a little on the small size, but who comes to Barcelona to sit in their hotel room? We had enough space to be comfortable and unpack our things. There are plenty of places to sit and people watch just steps from the front door of the Praktik. At many of the restaurants you have the choice of sitting inside or at the outdoor tables in the middle of the boulevard. The hotel is just a few blocks north of Placa Catalunya. This is a great access point to all areas of Barcelona via the HoHo buses. Upon check-out we were able to leave our bags until early afternoon. The staff arranged taxis to meet us at 2 PM to take us to the port for our cruise. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Praktik. Thanks! We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, bad smell”
Reviews.Author: CaKanoe
Reviews.Content: The location of this modern hotel built in a charming older building is unbeatable. It is very close to La Rambla, shopping, and the metro but not very noisy. The cheaper rooms are extremely small with no closet or room for suitcases etc. The beds however are very comfortable and clean. The back of the hotel faces adjacent buildings which proved to be a problem for us and some other unlucky guests when the neighbor building started farnishing their floors and then leaving their windows open. We slept one night with toxic fumes in our room. We used our sheets to protect us from the fumes. The hotel was full and couldn't move us anywhere so they said. This was very upsetting and felt like because we were in the cheaper rooms, we had no recourse. They were not very accommodating to us. I thought about moving to the first floor indoor outdoor lounge which is spacious and comfortable and probably should have. As an aside there is also one computer with internet access on this floor. The manager moved us to a large room on the 3rd floor with views facing out on the third day for one night only to make up for our inconvenience. He offered to have us stay the last night there if we paid the upgrade. I decided to not pay the upgrade fee for the next night and then changed my mind when I saw the space. These rooms cost more to upgrade to but are really worth it. They are huge in comparison to the inside double rooms. When I went back down to say we definitely would stay in the big room and pay the difference, they said we couldn't. We stayed another night in a smaller room without smell because they needed the large room for someone else. We were upset to have to move 3 times during our 4 day stay but Ruben was very helpful to us. Thanks. If we had not had the problem with the fumes, we would have enjoyed our stay there even though the room was so small. If you go, make sure to pay more and stay in the front rooms. They are really nice. We went on to stay at the AC Barcelona and even though it is a bigger hotel and not as centrally located, the staff were so much nicer and more helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra-modern, great location!”
Reviews.Author: hugehands
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the location! The rooms are a little snug, but very clean and well-decorated. The staff is mostly helpful and personable. No regrets!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel with very helpful and friendly staff !”
Reviews.Author: reisekatze11
Reviews.Content: My 15 year old son and 21 year old daughter and I stayed in the hotel for 4 days in July. The location is very good, only a few minutes from La Rambla and Barri Gotic Quarter and near to metro station. It is in an old building but has been tastefully renovated to a boutique contemporary style. We had a extra large WOW double room with an additional bed, big flat screen TV.... The hotel was economically priced and very modern. Our room was very spacious with very large beds and the shower room overlooked the lovely quiet garden area with garden furnitures and deckchairs and shower. The staff was extremely helpful! I would like to add a special thanks to the friendly, competent and patient night concierge (July 20th) for arranging medical help for my daughter!! I would recommend this hotel to anyone! Hotel Praktik Rambla will be our first choice if we ever return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Brillant Hotel, prime loation, chic rooms, friendly staff & reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: murray08
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 4 days early July. Three double rooms with ensuite shower rooms. My Husband and I, My 16 year old son and 10 year old son and my mother and father in law. The hotel was spotless and very modern. Our rooms were very spacious and overlooked the garden area, which we all enjoyed in the morning and early evening for a quiet family gathering. The staff were extremely helpful even to the point of agreeing to hold our luggage for a few hours the following week when we were due to come off our 7 day cruise. We saw many people having to cart around their luggage for the day and we were luggage free. Gold Star for Praktik. We tried to do alot in our 4 days and took the open top bus around Barcelona for 2 days which is well worth the money. As this hotel is bed only we ate in a couple of cafes near by for breakfast or got a few coffees and rolls and ate in the garden but when it came to evening meal we ate in a few different restaurants but our best fined believe it or not was La Botiga which is right next door to the Praktik. The food was excellent, very chic, presenation was superb and most surprizingly the prices were very reasonable from 3 euros for a starter, 7 euros a main etc. The staff were very friendly. We unfortunately went to the sea front to spend a few hours and get a traditional paella but were stung for 130 euros and it was dreadful. I wish I could remember the restaurants name but better I don't. Got to give hotel and staff *****. Alan, Beth & Family from Scotland

Reviews.Title: “The Praktik Rambla was an incredible find.”
Reviews.Author: bjhughes
Reviews.Content: The hotel was perfectly located two blocks away from the top of La Rambla, and one block from a central Metro station, in a quiet, elegant neighborhood. The hotel was an architectural treasure, the rooms were very large, and beautifully decorated, and the staff was very helpful and outgoing.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny, tiny room, but very clean and recently renovated with contempory style”
Reviews.Author: xli123
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the reviews, location, and reasonable rate. But I didn't realize the room is really tiny (standard room). There're no chairs, or deck because there's no room for that. When you get in the room, the only place you can go is the bed. You do everything in bed, watch TV, browse web with your laptop, etc. I have never seen or stayed in such a tiny room. At first, we thought maybe we were unlucky being given a bad room. So, we went to the front desk but were told all the standard rooms are the same size. The hotel manager did show us the other available standard rooms when we insisted to see them. He was right they are all the same tiny size and can only hold a bed. The bathroom is pretty new and recently renovated with contempary style, and very functional. No complaint. The room is very clean. No complaint. There's no instuctions how to use the phone. I had to go downstairs to ask the front desk to how to reach them by phone. They told me simply hit #9 to get to them, but there's nothing in the room telling me that. The locaton is perfect. No complaint. I would recommend this hotel if you don't mind staying in bed once you are in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bsmith_10
Reviews.Content: My daughter, her friend and I stayed 5 nights at the hotel. Overall, we enjoyed our stay. The hotel is nicely located. There is no fitness center on the premises as stated on the website!

Reviews.Title: “Location, style and comfort”
Reviews.Author: drlindake
Reviews.Content: My husband, 18 year old daughter and I stayed in room 405 - a triple room facing the street (Rambla Cataluna), for 6 nights during the world cup finals. Many other reviewers clearly describe this lovely hotel. Our relevant experiences: free wifi that worked flawlessly, uniformly friendly and helpful staff, a stylish, quiet and peaceful room despite being on the busy street, an amazing location close to the action but away from the fray, and a clean, comfortable, affordable home base from which to explore the city. We had no need for a pool, room service, an ice machine, a gym or a restaurant and did not miss them. Our room was lovely - compact, but with strategically placed mirrors and clever furnishings that maximize space. Two small balconies were a real treat from which to observe street life. Each balcony had 4 ways to shut out the street - double glass french doors and three "pocket door" shutter/glass choices to close out noise and/or light - an additional set of glass doors, a set of louvered doors and a set of closed panel doors. Close them all and it's as dark and quiet as a tomb. The beds are great. The temperatures were in the 90's during our stay and the AC was adequate but we're from Miami and used to the heat. The cupboards and safe are black inside, so check carefully to be sure you don't leave anything behind. The green bathroom tiles are elegant but dark compared to the beautiful light in the room. The shower is exceptional. To answer a previous concern about triple room bathrooms - our bathroom door was mirrored on the outside but a closed panel on the inside. Very roomy and totally private. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel (alas, I could not manage to win a free breakfast by guessing the correct soccer scores). We enjoyed the healthy and inexpensive takeout breakfasts and lunches at Nostrum across the street. Tapas were almost always a hit, as were fruit cups and smoothies from the market if you shop carefully for freshness. Our only disappointing food experience in Barcelona was paella in Barceloneta - a much less delicate version than we are accustomed to. We loved the location. An easy walk to Las Ramblas and other tourist destinations, the Airport Bus in Placa Cataluna, and several metro stops. The street has some foot traffic during the day, but was often closed to cars. This hotel is a winner if you are looking for a stylish, comfortable, friendly and affordable hotel from which to explore the city. It is particularly attractive if you need a triple room and have no need for room service, pool, spa, etc. Don't be afraid of the street side - it's lively and exciting, but can be totally quiet at night if you choose. Excellent value. It will be my first choice if I ever return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel, excellent position and staff super friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: Jill1056
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel, excellent position, staff super friendly and helpful. Extemely comfortable beds, excellent powerful showers and considering the position very quiet. (We had a front room and we were there when Spain was celebrating it's win in the semi-final of the World Cup and although there was plenty of celebrations we did not have a disturbed nights sleep)Usually we stay in 'high end' business hotels with all the 'trimmings' but from now on our trips to Barcelona we will always return here.

Reviews.Title: “Ticks the boxes for a short city break”
Reviews.Author: wingshoes
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Praktik for a couple of nights in Barcelona. Our room was at the rear of the building, was spacious, quiet and spotlessly clean. The hotel is very close -5 mins walk - to the Placa Catalunya where the airport bus stops, making the transfer quick and easy. The location of the hotel is excellent, if like us you want to walk to the major attractions in the city. Breakfast can be taken in the tapas bar ( owned by the hotel ) next door for which a voucher is purchased at reception - we did this once but wouldn't repeat it -far nicer and cheaper are the bakeries in the old town.Had a very good meal however at La Botiga restaurant next door. Atmosphere in the hotel a bit bleak -result of the "design" label I think - but overall a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Easy”
Reviews.Author: Zppalee
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel! Lovely, stylish and in a great central location. Also, very easy to get to by the Aerobus from the airport (5 euros and 3 blocks walk). We had one of the big back rooms that overlooked the patio and it was quiet and cool and perfect after the redeye from NYC. The hotel is situated perfectly -- quiet but close to all the action. And the tapas bar downstairs, Pisco Labis, became a welcome and easy place for breakfasts and afternoon snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Modernist building with immaculately clean rooms in the heart of Barcelona. Get a room with a terrace!”
Reviews.Author: Palachinka
Reviews.Content: Sandwiched between the Old City and the Eixample, the Praktik Ramblas is a wonderfully charming, chic hotel with the absolute best location in all of Barcelona. Those seeking cookie-cutter venues are better off looking elsewhere. At Praktik, you find a building typical of the Eixample, with a grand modernist facade and an intimate courtyard. While every corner tells a story of a bygone era, the interior has been renovated to meet the needs of the 21-century traveler: free Wi-Fi, large showers, queen-sized beds, flat-screen TV are standard in all rooms. Even better, one of Barcelona's best tapas bar - Cuitat Comtal - is on the same block as the Praktik. One piece of advice: we were initially given a room in the back of the hotel (facing the courtyard), which was too dark and with no view. Upon request, we were moved to a room facing La Ramblas, which was far superior: it had two large windows with a terrace, plenty of light, a larger bathroom and TV. Sitting on the terrace late at night while sipping Cava was perhaps the most romantic evening of our stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Very well run, terrific location”
Reviews.Author: HuxtableDan
Reviews.Content: Prototypical European boutique hotel! Friendly staff, mod rooms with lovely tile floors, functional air conditioner, free Internet, great location, near all nightlife but not smack in the middle (not too noisy or rowdy), near metro station. We recommend the praktik wow upgrade, which gave us a huge bed and more space.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: JSR16
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based off of others reviews and the price of the rooms. I will say that this was a wonderful stay in Barcelona. The hotel is about a 5 minute walk away from the main part of the Ramblas and Plaza de Catalunya. Very close proximity to everything (food, cafes, sites, etc.). The hotel is very cool because it is in an older building in which they kept much of the old architecture but then built a contemporary hotel within it. Our room was right on the street with a balcony and we had no issues with noise at night. You can slide shades over the window to help block out any noise/light. For the price, you just cna't beat it. We will recommend to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: meetamitpandey
Reviews.Content: The first thing that came to our minds when we walked into our room was "WOW". The location is excellent with most of the tourist places within a walking distance. We paid a little extra for the exterior large rook with a balcony overlooking the Ramblas street, which was good. They also have a small terrace which is very nice. Plenty of very good eating joints to enjoy in the vicinity. Didn't try hotel's breakfast but there was a "Sandwich & Friends" about a block away, which was a wonderful place to eat and hangout. The people at the front desk were all very friendly and cheerful. Hard to find anything negative... just one point, though not very significant, was that out bathroom floor wasn't dried up/cleaned during the regular housekeeping while we were away.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - lived up to all the reviews! Recommended.”
Reviews.Author: YYZtotheworld
Reviews.Content: Booked this on the basis of the overwhelming number of great reviews on Tripadvisor. Without question, this hotel lived up to expectations. Clean, modern, well located and easy on the budget. We had a very small room, but was located on the top floor and not facing the street (which we didn't mind given we'd seen the reviews on street noise being an issue). Bed was comfortable, bathroom clean and great water pressure. Free wi-fi throughout was a nice touch. Lounge on the 2nd floor was also a nice oasis to relax in (first time I'd ever seen a lemon tree!). The gothic architecture of the hotel is also something to look at. Front desk staff very helpful and genuinely friendly. Location is perfect, just on the top part of Las Ramblas. Subway stops are a block or two away (as is Passieg de Garcia, where the train from the airport connects). I'd gladly stay here again. Don't let the star rating fool you... it's just the lack of other amenities (which we wouldn't have used anyway), such as pool, fitness area or restaurant that results in a lower star rating. Strongly recommended quality hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish accomodation with friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Phil_Westgarth
Reviews.Content: The service on the whole was very good, the staff were pleasant and friendly, and there was always someone available to offer assistance. The hotel is approx a 5 minute walk from the Plaza De Catalunya, and so is ideally situated for sightseeing on the tourist bus or to wander through the Ramblas and Gothic quarter. Set in a lovely part of Barcelona within easy walking distance of Gaudi's Casa Mila and Casa Battlo. The room itself was compact but well appointed, with excellent facilities in the bathroom and everything you need for a comfortable stay, most notably a comfortable bed!

Reviews.Title: “Slick and Well-Located”
Reviews.Author: Canucdude
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of places to choose from in Barcelona and for us it came down to location, cool factor of the hotel and availability of a 3-person room. Hotel Praktik Rambla delivered on all three counts. Pro's: 1. Location: At the "top" of the Ramblas, Barcelona's touristy but fun walking avenue, the Praktik is well located. In fact by being 2 blocks up from Placa Catalunya, this means that you are just removed enough from the insanity of the Ramblas, but really by only 5-10 minutes walk. Restaurants abound (although we have yet to find decent, regular food in Spain after 1/2 dozen visits, more below), cafes are everywhere (Starbucks a block away - sorry it had been 5 weeks!) and parking is alright too (20 euros by special arrangement with the hotel). Driving in from the highway was a breeze. Placa Catalunya's proximity means that the excellent and sometimes air conditioned metro is right there too. 2. Room. First thing to mention is that getting a room with a third bed in Barcelona was very difficult. But this place does it, in a very large and comfortable room (room 410). Now if modern makes you cringe, don't think about this place. This is old building completely "funkified" - old wood stripped bare and juxtaposed with crazy colours. Gaudi left his mark on Barcelona and since then its citizens have had license to get away with anything. But it works very well, IMHO - as a modern design fan. Some more below on the room. 2. Service. This was a mixed bag that ended well, so it is a pro for me. First, the receptionist on arrival was quite a "business-like" person - formal almost school-teacher-like - lighten up and join the customer service world! A request for a good venue to watch a world cup game was met with: "just go out into the street, there are lots of restaurants to choose from". Thanks for the advice, that thought never came to me... The next few problems were resolved by the receptionist we had in the morning. She was a delight to deal with, giving us advice of all sorts and even booking a restaurant for us. THAT was service. The 3 complaints we had with the room: 1. The "rain' shower was completely plugged with calcium deposits and was shooting painfully out of the remaining few unplugged holes. Upon our return this was sorted out. 2. The aircon was a bit lame. I think they fixed it a bit, but it never did work fully. But we were comfortable enough. It was very hot outside 3. Finally, the morning room cleaners made an absolute racket going in and out of their storage room down the hall and slamming the door each time. It did not recur the next morning (after we complained. Con's: 1. Service: See above complaint about receptionist. Also, they have this empty patio on the first floor that has this modern, BRIGHT light. As we overlooked it, it was quite bright well past midnight (with nobody ever there) in the room. Tone it down about 10,000 lumens and save the environment in the process! 2. WiFi: They have free wifi, but it could not reach our room! That's not very useful. In this day and age, people are not using it just to send emails, but they use it to plan their trip, reserve restaurants, book trips, checkin. Given the low cost of a wifi setup, free and well-functioning wifi is as essential as a good toilet. Hints: 1. Starbucks: A block down for those who need their "home" fix. 2. Food: Bring your own food to Spain. Of course this is in jest, but there doesn't seem to be anything in the mid-price world that is not Italian. And it is really, really bad Italian, worse than the Olive Garden chain (never thought that was possible). And tapas just don't appeal to me. I have no expectations for reasonably-priced, good food anymore. The "El Raco" next to the Praktik is awful - run away unless you hate yourself. "Happy Grill" dpwn a block was not much better. "Pans & Company" was ok for a sandwich and coffee. But frankly, prison food is probably better. Next time, go to the French border and do take-out... 3. FC Barca: Do the visit of Camp Nou - excellent, excellent with the new interactive setup. 4. Servicaixa: Book your event tix online and pick them up at the bank machine at the Caixa (bank) outlets. Wow, nice to have competition to Ticketmaster! Conclusion: The Hotel Praktik Ramblas is an excellent choice for Barcelona, maybe your best choice for a 3-person room. Location, decor, and some good service.

Reviews.Title: “Location and elegance”
Reviews.Author: paul1607
Reviews.Content: The hotel is desined as a boutique hotel with minimal amenities and is perfect for a weekend break. It is very well located with friendly and capable staff. The building has an understated elegance and is well maintained and spotlessly clean. The rooms are well designed to get the most out of sometimes limited space and the terrace proved a great place to relax. I would not hesitate to recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Robert B
Reviews.Content: Pros: Spacious and clean rooms, cool contemporary design, really comfy beds, quiet - even though we faced the street (and I am a light sleeper), free wi-fi, terrific location, very modest price = a great value, helpful staff. Con: No cafe or bar, but that's why it's no so expensive. There are dozens of cafes and restaurants within 1 minute of the hotel. There is a great bakery, Rambla 31, across the street. For 9 euros I got 4 pastries and 4 cafe americano's to go. Can't beat that!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dive288
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a small boutique hotel in a perfect location in Barcelona. The hotel was very close to the high end shopping along Passig de Gracia. There are great Tapa restaurants right down the street and the bakery on the corner was the best. The room was very clean, and stylish. It had just the right amount of closet space and a great balcony. I will definitely stay here again the next time I am in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Small but comfortable room in a good area close to everything”
Reviews.Author: AEF_9
Reviews.Content: I had a small, single room, but it was comfortable with all the mod cons. This hotel is a nice boutique hotel, very friendly and good location only a couple of blocks from Plaza Catalunya and the beginning of Las Ramblas. Also free Wi-Fi, as well as free computer access if you don't have a laptop with you.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend Hotel Praktik Rambla”
Reviews.Author: cruisersinct
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Praktik for 1 night on June 2, 2010 before we boarded a Celebrity cruise out of Barcelona. We learned about this hotel from reading Trip Advisor and the reviews written by travelers, and decided to book a night at this hotel. We were a bit nervous about the booking because we have not taken a trip to Europe previously. We loved the hotel. It was a old hotel with lots of character yet the room was very clean, recently renovated and up to date, and the bathroom was very, very nice; updated and very clean. The location was great on Las Ramblas and we were very comfortable in walking around the area, and enjoyed a wonderful Tapas and Sangria dinner at the outdoor cafe just next door to the hotel. The hotel staff spoke English and were very helpful with our questions and provided great recommendations, including a double decker bus tour of the city (taken from a spot just a few blocks from the hotel). The tour was very informative and a great way to see lots of Barcelona in a short period of time. I wish the hotel served a light breakfast or coffee in the morning, but there is a nice local bakery just a 1/2 block from the hotel. Also, we had a room that faced the Las Ramblas street and it was a bit noisy during the night as residents like to eat late and enjoy a beautiful evening out. If you want quiet, suggest you ask about this when you select your room. Thank you, fellow travelers, for providing your reviews as it was so helpful to us.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: kitschcat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night at the tail end of our holiday in Barcelona. Having previously stayed at another hotel that week (which was fine) the Praktik blew me away! We stayed in room 209 which is the "super room" of the hotel, with a luxuriously big bedroom, bathroom, and terrace with fantastic views, it is worth the money! The hotel itself is beautiful and well located on the Rambla (but the more sophisticated end). The staff were very friendly and helpful, and despite not providing any food at the hotel there are many great places right outside the door. For breakfast I took a 2 min walk down to the right of the hotel and brought back Starbucks coffee and croissants to have on the terrace. I could not fault this hotel and would really love to go again one day!

Reviews.Title: “best hotel we've stayed at in terms of value and quality”
Reviews.Author: rachana4
Reviews.Content: Location was fantastic, being at the quieter (and posher) end of La Rambla. Front desk staff were very helpful. Classily designed hotel. Couldn't have asked for much more.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely done, but small”
Reviews.Author: Desertconnoisseur
Reviews.Content: Lovely decorations, beautiful patio and very helpful staff. The bathroom looks like it came from a trendy architectural magazine. However, this is not a hotel for anyone who will be spending time in the room doing anything but sleeping or showering. The room is so small, that the large, comfortable king size bed barely fits with room to walk around it. This is probably the tiniest hotel room I have ever seen. There is no furniture other than the bed and its built-in shelves. Even the TV is mounted on the foot of the bed. It is a bit pricey for the size of the room, but an enjoyable place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful old building in the centre of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Sophie009
Reviews.Content: We arrived late due to the last ash cloud problem, reception staff were always pleasant and helpful. Our room was large, we paid extra for a small balcony, the bathroom was huge with a massive shower head. The bed was comfortable and had no problem sleeping, although I was worried about comments made by other people about noise from street below. We took our own travel kettle as there arent any provided, I prefer to eat and drink before going out in the mornings, we bought some fruit from the market . The other small gripe I have is it would have been good to have an English news channel provided, we certainly do not go on holiday to watch TV, but do like to catch the news. The outside seating area was lovely although we did not have time to try it out, there were plenty of tables and chairs. We stayed from Monday to Friday and our towels were only changed once, I did request clean ones as they were too wet to use, unfortunately they arrived after 12am when we were in bed, needless to say we did not answer the door, so did not get our towels changed. The good points are the hotel is in acentral position, is an amazing building with original features. There is a good tapas restaurant next to the hotel but do not go to Italian to the right of hotel exit as we found it to be very poor. We used the airport bus the A2, we found it to be an excellent service, plenty of room for luggage, it was only around 17E for 2 people return. We also used the underground system which was very efficient and cheap to use. The only problem we had was with the self service ticket machine, it was all in Spannish. We asked for assistance and with sign language and our limited knowledge of Spannish we were soon on our way. The weather was wall to wall sunshine, Barcelona is a great place to visit so much to see and do.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jane0515
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel and the staff. The building is beautiful and has been nicely updated. The rooms are spacious and the bathrooms are very nice. The staff is exceptional. They made a dinner reservation for us and made other recommendations for dinner, etc. The outdoor terrace is very nice. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Telodigoluego
Reviews.Content: I travel quite extensively every year for leisure and this is one of my best experience ever in a hotel stay. What a charming, warmhearted service, cozy, wonderful hotel. From the moment you walk in you get the feeling that you have arrived to a special place, a different kind of hotel. Check in is actually a lovely experience! (where in any hotel it would be a dull or annoying moment, in this hotel it's nice and easy). The hotel is situated on Las Ramblas the most beautiful boulevard in Barcelona. Please note that the location is not Ramblas Catalunya where the crazy partying goes on in the city; Las Ramblas, the one of the hotel, is a charming and rather quiet street in the center of Barcelona, just one block away from the famous Passeig de Gracia with plenty of restaurants and exclusive boutique shops (Casa Batllo, a famous Gaudi masterpiece is at a 8 minutes walk from the hotel). There is a metro station half a block away. If you need a taxi, don't worry there are several cabs parked across the street from the hotel. On site there is one of the fines tapas restaurants of Barcelona, called Piscolabis, where breakfast is served every morning at an aceptable rate. There are several tapas restaurants and a pizzeria (pizza place) a stone throw away. We had a superior room which was spacious and well fitted and a double room which was rather small, yet cozy and comfortable . I would suggest you request a superior room, for just a small extra amount it is quite convenient. The building of the hotel is the admired La Casa Climent Arola, a beautiful design by the renowned catalan arquitect Francesc Villar. The facade is precious, the entrance is magestic and the lobby, although small, is very special. There is a lounge on the first floor with books and a nice decor with a door that connects to a lovely terrace with a shower and vending machines hidden behind a white curtain. There is a computer for everyone to use on the first floor with free Internet. There is wi fi free Internet throughout the hotel. There is nothing to complaint about the hotel. The service is superb in every way. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and I will surely stay at the Praktik Ramblas on my next visit to the always wonderful city of Barcelona. My appreciation to Gloria Martin, Maria Gomez y Ruben Hernando for their superb service. They excel in every way!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service in a beautiful building”
Reviews.Author: NoSoupForYou
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a fantastic few days at the Praktik Rambla; you could really call it two stays after our unplanned return from the airport as a result of the volcanic ash cloud. Maria and another member of staff really went out of their way to accommodate us for three extra nights at such short notice. We did not at all miss the lack of a restaurant as we had a great guide book so we were never far from a great eating place. Our first room was clean, modern and perfectly laid out, if a little bit smaller than we were expecting. This was not really an issue though as we spent our time out. The bed was huge and the shower not much smaller. As we got to try out two more rooms during our extended stay, we think we experienced the complete range of accommodation. These were bigger, lighter rooms with fantastic original features and good views across the terrace to the rear of the building. We will almost definitely return to Praktik Rambla if we visit Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with perfect location”
Reviews.Author: MrBelpit
Reviews.Content: The service was good, the room nice and the location is excellent. The price for the period we stayed in the hotel still promised a bit more than we did get but all in all it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel In Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: MoloyBiswas
Reviews.Content: We took the Aerobus from the Barcelona Airport and reached Catalunya sqaure quite comfortably. It was a walking distance of 5 minutes from the Catalunya square to the hotel. We were greeted well at the arrival and our checking process did not take much time. The gentlemen [I forgot his name, probably Estophan] was quite helpful and understood that me and my wife were tired after 12 hours of flight and immediately helped us to the nearest restaurant locations so that we could get some brunch and go off to sleep. On the day, we met Gloria at the reception and she helped us with the sightseeing routes and got us the Bus touristic tickets. We roamed around Barcelona during the day and routes which Gloria told us really helped. Thanks Gloria!!! My wife took couple of pictures with Gloria so that we could capture her beautiful smile. The hotel was good to sleep and take rest after the tiring sightseeing....The hotel is very close to the famous La Ramblas and we had gone for a walk to the Catalunya square after our dinner. But people intending to visit Barcelona should be aware of pickpockets and snatchers, however we did not face any such problem. Close to the hotel there are lot of Tapas bars and Restaurants, which I think is a good place to spend some time. We will definitely stay at Praktik Rambla if we ever visit Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy”
Reviews.Author: Lynny07
Reviews.Content: I arrived by train from Cordoba via Madrid. An excellent service & on time. Firstly make sure you head for Rambla Catalunya,27, and not de las Ramblas. I loved the neighbourhood only 2 blocks from Gaudi's Casa Batllo in one direction and the busy, de las Ramblas in the other direction. An old building refurbished into modern contemporary rooms with free internet, a lovely sitting room with huge windows out to a rooftop garden courtyard with many lounges and tables to enjoy the outdoors. My room definitely a single, compact but cleverly designed space, well presented & a nice place to sleep but too small to spend time in ... yet value for money in this location.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Rose0104
Reviews.Content: We had a great room with a beautiful balcony and view. The rooms are modern and the entire hotel has a hip vibe without being ridiculous or overly trendy. The front desk staff were very helpful and, thankfully for us, spoke good English. The best part from our perspective was the location. You are close to Las Ramblas, but near the "nicer" part and one block over from the main drag of Eixample. The hotel is also very convenient to the subway, which we found easy to navigate. Great restaurants nearby, but it would have been nice if the hotel had a bar. Also, if you book a room on the street side, it is very noisy until the wee hours of the night (Barcelona is afterall a bustling city with a lot of nightlife), but we assumed this when we booked and brought earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best”
Reviews.Author: PerthWATraveller23
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at this hotel based on the reviews on Trip Advisor. All the positive reviews that has been posted about the hotel are accurate. I would like to add a special thanks to the staff at the hotel during our visit. We were caught up in the volcanic ash saga. During that time the staff (especially Gloria) were most patient and helpful to us. As I solo traveller the room was small but adequate for my purposes. I would like to return to Barcelona one day and would definitely stay at Praktik Rambla again.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, modern”
Reviews.Author: Purplestategal
Reviews.Content: Loved the uber modern decor, friendly staff, and location.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Rainlord
Reviews.Content: The Praktik Rambla, located a stone's throw from Plaza de Catalunya (which is to say, 2 blocks north) on the much more quiet Rambla de Catalunya, is fantastic (and you're a 5 min walk from the airport bus). The entrance to the hotel and the design in and around it is great and modern but with a rustic feel. The staff (and I think we met about 3 different front-desk-clerks) was all amazingly friendly, always cheerful and happy to help and were fun to joke with (I prefer fun staff instead of purely professional staff, these were both). And should they be busy with another guest, sit like a king in the "Princess chairs" in the lobby while you wait. I read all the other reviews (for this and the top #30 hotels in Barcelona) before deciding on this one, and as I've now been there, I can say they are nearly all spot on. Those who got unlucky with some aspect of the hotel staff or cleaning, probably got just that, unlucky, happens at any hotel. I saw some less-than-accommodating guests who gave the staff a hard time over literally nothing (directions to a Museum for example), and they treated that person like a king regardless. That's good service - and it always came with a smile. The room was surprisingly small (not much space beyond the bed) but tastefully decorated with bold but neutral colors and (very) high ceilings (they should almost make some pully-system for hoisting up your suitcase into the air). The bathroom was in contrast very big, and decorated with funky green tile and the shower-head is the biggest I have ever seen, you'll love it! The only drawback to the room was that it felt slightly cramped at times and there was no good place to put your suitcase, and clothing storage was also scarce. That said, after the initial "surprise", we made it work just fine and thought no more of it. There's also an in-room safe that's quite large (although beyond a 15" laptop you won't fit it). The room got cleaned to perfection every day, and the "Spa products" (shampoo etc) are truly top notch, I think every guest "steals" a few of those. If you plan on spending lots of time in your room, this is not your hotel, and probably not your city either for that matter, for any other type of trip, this is a brilliant hotel. The beds are very comfortable and the pillows are great (this goes a long way in my book), and in our case the room (number 311) was quiet and we slept with the windows open (there is an A/C as well if needed, in April the nights are still slightly chilly). The back patio of the hotel (first floor) is wonderful, with loads of comfortable lounge chairs and sofas and is very secluded. There's no pool, but if you're in Barcelona for that kind of activity, just go to the beach instead. Instead, buy some Cava (Spanish Champagne) and some Chorizo (spicy sausage) and take a siesta on the deck, that's what we did. The restaurant next door serves as the "hotel restaurant", but in Barcelona you really don't need a restaurant in the hotel, there's food to be had literally everywhere. That said, the restaurant next door serves excellent food, their egg-based breakfast tapas are amazing, try one. All in all, we loved the hotel, the staff (A+), the location, and we were happy to come back to it after trekking, eating and shopping all over Barcelona. Will definitely come back to this hotel if I have the option & the money to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!”
Reviews.Author: Johnsonwax
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is great. It is in an excellent position. There are plenty of bars, restaurants around. Our room was lovely, very modern and the shower was lovely. Breakfast was not available but it did not matter as there were plenty of places to eat near to the hotel. There is a lovely area to sit out on at the rear of the hotel. The staff were really helpful, especially as we were there during the volcanic ash incident. If you want a small, clean, modern hotel that is very central, do not hesitate in stopping here. We would definitely recommend to other people and would stay there again. Thank you to everyone at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Location, Very Cool”
Reviews.Author: grahamhunter1978
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and the hotel was incredibly cool and funky - lovely architecture and trendy interiors. Great location - close enough to walk to the buzz of the bars etc - but just far enough out to be quiet. We choose a standard double and had asked for a quiet room but did end up with a very small room - especially compared to friends who had a twin room which was 4 times the size. We did ask to be moved but were told the hotel was full - so definitely ensure you get a decent size room. Staff were very friendly and helpful - be very careful with your personal belongings - definitely use the safes in the room as we did have our phone and wallet stolen either in the city or possibly from the hotel - you can never be really sure!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, helpful staff and very good location”
Reviews.Author: Traveler000000
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Praktik Rambla for 5 nights as pre-cruise. Lovely! We enjoyed the room, very clean,comfortable and of good dimension. Their location is perfect, close to everything. This boutique hotel is an hidden gem! Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “It was very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: olympiatzini
Reviews.Content: We were in Barcelona for 6 days. The hotel was lovely, excellent situated in the centre of the city and the staff at the reception desk was very helpfull and they spoke very good english as well. The rooms, two double rooms, were clean and comfortable thow not very spacius. There was also free wifi and a corner with a laptop on the first floor that anyone could use. Our reservation didn't include any breakfast so we can't review on it. There is no bar in the hotel ( as far as we know as there was no brochure about the amenities of the hotel which is rather odd) and even the lobby is very small, just two armchairs to sit and wait for your turn, but that didn't bother us. All in all it was a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: hadd0ck
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights during a week-long stay in Barcelona in mid-April. We upgraded to the balcony room and were extremely impressed with the room. The room was clean and tastefully decorated, the view was amazing and the bed extremely comfortable. The front desk staff was superb. Top all this off with the absolutely perfect location and you have a great hotel in Praktik Rambla. We could not have been happier with this hotel. I wish we had booked our other 3 nights at this hotel as well.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in the right part of town”
Reviews.Author: charliechan_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Praktic Rambla for three nights, ( don't let the strange name put you off) its a wonderful old building that used to be a palace in the early 19th century, it has been very subtly converted retaining all the old features, the rooms are a bit on the small side but very tastefully decorated ( ultra modern) very clean and very helpful staff, you can get a full English or continental breakfast for only 7.5 Euros. its in a nice quite part of the city yet only a few minuets walk from all the activity, We highly recommend the hotel Dave Kath, Fred and Jean UK

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: swiss_voyager83
Reviews.Content: Great location walking distance to La rambla Very good sized rooms and good size bathroom. superb showers in the bathroom that come directly from above as well as a separate shower extension that can be used! Brilliant! The staff at the front desk were helpful and friendly. The restaurant next door which is part of the hotel has excellent tapas. Free wifi We paid 100 euros per night...think that was good value for Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good, with reservations”
Reviews.Author: mdexterlilly
Reviews.Content: Firstly - excellent location and very clean (bathroom always spotless). Reception friendly and helpful. Internal rooms dark, no view, and horrible noise from air conditioning unit which seemed to be above our room (411). Balcony rooms might be better, but there could be noise from the street. Noisy through two nights with people shouting and talking on the stairs at 2 and 3am . . . plus the breakfasts were hilarious - always one component missing and watching the waiter very carefully walking with four bowls of milk on a tray (we were all having cereal) was a hoot - don't they have a jug ? !!! We used to go over to a little cafe called "Nostrum" afterwards for proper orange juice and some fruit. I missed having somewhere to sit in the room other than the bed.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the Most Part”
Reviews.Author: PixelsnFluff
Reviews.Content: After reading the many stellar reviews here, my husband booked us for four nights at the Praktik earlier this week, requesting a balcony room as mentioned on the hotel's website. No communication was received about the request but when we arrived we were given a small, dark room on the fourth floor with one window looking out onto some back walls of other buildings. The room itself was nice enough, the bed was large, and the bathroom was terrific - large and well-appointed with a great shower. Unfortunately the room had nowhere to sit other than the bed itself which is not terribly comfortable for a multi-day stay. The communal lounge area on the first floor is comfortable though, with a large area inside and an even bigger terrace. When we asked about the room we were given there was a half-hearted response about the fact that the hotel was full and there wasn't anything else available. The second day we were there we again asked if there were any brighter rooms available and were told that you have to request balcony rooms when you make the reservation and pay extra and that the hotel was full. In fact, we would have been happy to pay extra for a better-located room, but that had never been communicated to us in any way. Other than not being terribly helpful about the rooms, the staff seemed ok, friendly enough as we came and left each day. Free wi-fi is a plus in any hotel and the signal here was strong but the internet never worked properly for us. Some sites were never accessible and it was impossible to post blog entries or upload photos or check in for our flights. The PC in the lounge area seemed to connect to sites better than our laptops so maybe the wireless network has some different configurations. After the lukewarm response to our room enquiries, we never did talk with the staff about the wireless problems. The elevator broke on our second day at the hotel. With a room on the 4th floor (with very high ceilings) this was a tiresome inconvenience. The elevator was fixed promptly the next day though. The location is very nice, just a block and a half from Placa Catalunya, very convenient to public transportation, restaurants, shopping and sights.
