I would really like to say we had a fantastic stay at the hotel but with the internet, elevator and room hassles I would have to say it was just ok. I would recommend it but with reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: leecylee
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. Our room was adequate, nicely designed. The shower was really modern and great. I loved the location....walking distance to everything, but on the less crazy/crowded side of las ramblas. It was perfect. The only drawback was that the walls are thin and I could hear neighbors talking and alarm clocks and cleaning staff made lots of noise in the morning in the hallways. All the sounds echo so everything seemed loud and it was hard to sleep in the morning. But if you're an early riser, it shouldn't be a problem.

Reviews.Title: “5star stay!”
Reviews.Author: CopenhagenBella
Reviews.Content: Absolutely great hotel! It's a rather small, cosy and amazingly beautiful hotel in the heart of Barcelona. In the midst of the Rambla. Staff were really helpfull ! I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Praktik is for Practical!”
Reviews.Author: Dani5520
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five days during our honeymoon, the hotel staff was excellent, they really went above and beyond for us. They are always ready with a good suggestion, be it directions, places to eat, or things to do. If you are looking for a practical place, with no gimmicks, no frills, just a clean room with lots of charm, this is the place. The hotel has few amenities, but the staff is always there ready to help in any way. Also, the location can't be beat as you are right on Las Ramblas, but further up on the street from all the revelry so you are not bothered by the noise. We will be returning to Praktik Ramblas!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION AND STAFF”
Reviews.Author: mapwhe
Reviews.Content: This property is in a wonderful and very convenient location to all, mass transit, trains and busses and the sites. All within walking distance. The staff are very pleasant and check in was prompt. Even though the room was not ready we were made comfortable on the mezzanine with free internet and within 20 minutes in the room. Staff was able to make great recommendation for site seeing, food and methods of transportation. Remember you are in a big city with the associated noises such as street traffic, occasional sirens and sometimes loud drunks. The room was nice, never turned on the television but used the free wi-fi. A mini fridge would have been nice. There are two restaurants on either side of this hotel are very good One serves Tapas and the other, “La Botiga” with a very nice menu and a quieter atmosphere…all prices very reasonable for the area and very good service.

Reviews.Title: “love it love it love it!”
Reviews.Author: lisipoo
Reviews.Content: beautiful, comfortable, central location yet quiet, amazing staff. so fun to go back to at the end of the day. thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: MaggieMaeBoston
Reviews.Content: Everything was great about the place - location, room (with one exception), free internet. The only weird thing was that I was sharing a triple with two friends, and the door to the bathroom was all glass, with no covering of any kind - so you could see into the bathroom. And since the ceilings were very high and the door was huge (actually, it was a big double door), we couldn't simply use a towel or blanket to cover the glass. (It might make sense for a double, but in a triple, it's likely that you might not feel comfortable being seen nude by both of your travel companions!)

Reviews.Title: “ONE OF THE BESTS”
Reviews.Author: ORI-ISRAEL
Reviews.Content: A very good and nice hotel, great location, very friendly staff, special shower and very comfort and big bed. recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice decor terrible service.”
Reviews.Author: Aussieontherun
Reviews.Content: We arrived in barcelona after an early flight, got to the hotel at about 1 pm exhausted. They couldn't check us in which was fine because we were after all early. The guy told us he'd have our room ready for us in an hour so we left our bags went off and got some tapas and came back no less tired at about 215. The guy was gone and a girl in her early twenties was struggling to check in a large family. We waited (standing) in the tiny lobby for 45 mins before she was done with them and we could get her attention. I tried to explain to her that our room should be ready but she insisted someone else before us was waiting for a room so we'd have to wait. Another 30 mins wait plus ten for her to check us in we were so exhausted that I agreed to their full prepayment up front which I wasn't aware of just so we could get it over with and lie down. Finally we get to the room at about 340 an hour and 40 mins after check in and almost three hours after we arrived. But the room is nice and we lie down in blissful rest. Half an hour later woken up by bandsaw/power drilling/hammering next door. Figure it's probably one off and we should explore so we set off out of the room. Fast forward to 9am woken by power tools next door again. We complain and they deny all knowledge of it, say they'll look into it and never call us back. When we head down later we bring it up again and manage to get them to move our room though they do not apologize and infer we're imagining things. (we later find out two other couples on our floor had complained as well.) the rest of the trip went mostly without incident. I should say that the hotel is nice but the staff are borderline incompetent and if a problem arises you will not have a good stay and prepayment makes leaving/refunds impossible. As a side note the breakfast is very good but very small.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: anafi
Reviews.Content: Hotel Praktik Rambla is a very nice, good located hotel in the centre of Barcelona...The rooms are spacious and very clean. We stayed for 5 nights with a 2,5 year old girl. They gave us a room overlooking Rambla Catalunya which is crowded enough so if you cannot stand the noise ask for an inner room. The only "problem" we had is that it is not very kids-friendly, i.e. no refrigerator for a milk or yoghurt, or we could not easily warm the milk of the baby. However the staff is very helpful and they helped us with everything we asked for.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel near everything”
Reviews.Author: Pdelis50
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights, the Hotel is in the heart of Barcelona, Close enough to La Rambla, to easily walk to, yet far enough away so that it was quiet at night, Clean, Specious quiet and very comfortable room that also had a small balcony , great bathroom and shower. Plenty of the tapa bars and restaurants near by that are not super touristy. Also close to the metro, where we were easily visited La Sagrada Familia and The Camp Nou. Staff was also very friendly with our needs and questions. would stay again A note, if there is business convention in Barcelona, then hotels get pricey and hard to come by.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect tourist hotel”
Reviews.Author: utsy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in Feb 2010. Beautiful old traditional Spanish building, high ceilings, mosaic tiled floors etc, but with very modern funky rooms and bathrooms, including french windows opening out over the terrace. Great shower in the bathroom! Brilliant location as so central and walking distance to buzz of city centre, however room was very quiet with no street noise, very comfortable beds etc. Good restaurants right next door to hotel on both sides (pealla at La Tobiga (?) is great!), with both a cafe and a pattesiere nearby for breakfast. Couldn't recommend this more as a great base for tourists to explore the city. Staff were very very friendly and helpful also and there's a free internet access point.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: danasbox
Reviews.Content: Everything about this place works. As it's name it is a pratical place. And in an excellent location. There is always room for improvements but for the price this hotel is a bargin. Big room and comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly True!”
Reviews.Author: teolove
Reviews.Content: When my boyfriend and I entered the room, we couldnt belive what we were seeing. For only 70€ pn we got a very well furnished room with a huge bed, 2 sofas, and ldc tv set. Something not to forget is that the hotel is placed in the center of barcellona, just at the begginning of the "ramblas". I'll come back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: chrismalek
Reviews.Content: This hotel is recently remodeled. The design was very nice and stylish. The rooms were great. The staff were very friendly. After talking to the staff at the restaurant next door, it seems that the same company that owns the hotel, owns both the restaurants on either side of the hotel. We ate at both and they were both really good and were a really good value. I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: The_Touring_Bikers
Reviews.Content: A group of 22 of us stayed here for a weekend in January and no-one had a bad word to say about this hotel. I think that speaks volumes about the place. It has a central location, the rooms are a generous size and very comfortable. They have all the amenities you would expect (except maybe a mini-bar! ). The hotel does not have a restaurant but breakfast is provided in the excellent Piscolabis tapas restaurant next door. I am a regular visitor to Barcelona and I am delighted to have found this hotel and will definitely stay here again. Although it's well documented, I would like to add one warning - watch out for pickpockets when you are out and about.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for great location”
Reviews.Author: RosieCork
Reviews.Content: The hotel's architecture is beautiful. Our room was huge with a large bathroom, lovely decor and really comfortable beds. The bathroom was very well-appointed with tolietries and a power shower. Overall, highly reccommended, and would definitely return. Minor 'room-for-improvement' points: The floors are tile-beautiful but chilly in Winter- bring slippers! The room could have been warmer . Some written 'Introduction to Barcelona' information would have been helpful e.g Metro map These are small niggles however, and did not take from enjoyment of our great weekend in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “I BOOKED the PRAKTIK after reading all of these EXCELLENT reviews!”
Reviews.Author: NancyandJoe
Reviews.Content: All I can say is THANK YOU to everyone who took the time to write a review about the PRAKTIK RAMBLA. I will be traveling to Europe for my HONEYMOON. My new husband and I will be visiting, France (Cannes & Nice), Monaco (Monte Carlo), Italy (Florence, Rome, Naples and even Capri) and yes, we will also be visiting Spain (Barcelona) so I did all my homework first and made sure that we chose a hotel that was rated very highly. Needless to say, I was very pleased to read all the amazing things that other travelers wrote the PRAKTIK RAMBLA. So I booked a room with a balcony for our upcoming trip!

Reviews.Title: “Cute, Good Service, Great Recommendations"”
Reviews.Author: ec1228
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night and the service was very good. Our only concern was that we were asked to check in 1 hour after the normal check-in time because the guest who had our room checked out very late. But the front desk held our luggage and recommended a good tapas places to hang out and wait. Our other luggage was delayed and they worked with the airport to secure it. We needed advice and directions, the bilingual staffers helped us with everything. Free internet access in the hallway so we could email our families to advise of our safe arrival. We were very happy with our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located, comfortable, with awesome staff!”
Reviews.Author: SomersetWine
Reviews.Content: The Praktik Rambla was a small unknown hotel to me. In the spirit of full disclosure, I am a frequent traveler and have gotten kind of spoiled. We generally stay at the "W", St. Regis, Westin, or similar properties. When we visited Barcelona in December of 2007, we stayed at the Le Meridien. There was four of us staying this year. My wife, son (12), and my mother. Everyone enjoyed their rooms. My mother's room was small but well appointed. It was one of the inside rooms so it was a bit dark with no view. However, our room was right on the Rambla Catalunya. It had a great balcony that allowed us to observe the scene from our room. The bonus was that it had a triple layered door that completely shut out the light and street noise from outside. This is not a full service hotel but who needs it when you are in Barcelona on the Rambla? The staff were excellent, bilingual and extremely helpful. One of them (Gloria) when above and beyond calling a friend at Europecar so that I could return my car at the train station instead of going back to the airport. She was also full of great recommendations and hidden gems. The location of this hotel is good in that it is on a less crazy part of the Rambla closer to Avenida Diagonal and all of the high end shopping. I would recommend this hotel for its value alone.
